placeInfo: {'id': '10903452', 'name': "Seerock The King's Domain", 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 263, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.999112, 'longitude': 80.745415, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10903452-Reviews-Seerock_The_King_s_Domain-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://seerockthekingsdomain.com/', 'address': 'Indigawewa Sigiriya, Dambulla 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigawewa', 'street2': 'Sigiriya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 4, 'count4': 24, 'count5': 228}}
text: We chose to stay at Seerock for 2 nights when we went to Sigiriya. Sigiriya and Thoppigala is about a 20-minute drive from here. The staff members are super friendly and polite. The food was delicious (we had all three meals). Rooms are really spacious, clean, and tidy. We booked 2 rooms (Gajaba and Harindra) for 4 of us. One room comes with a jacuzzi, and the other one had a plunge pool. In the morning, you can hear peacocks ü¶ö calling. The restaurant and the bar are on the upper floor. You can see the upper part of the Sigiriya and Thoppigala rocks from the restaurant. The pool was clean and spacious. I highly recommend this place to anyone who loves to stay close to nature.
title: Great service. Friendly staff.

text:
We stayed here with our family of fice.
Is this the perfect, European standard five star hotel? No!
But is this the perfect hotel for a short stay in the area, with spacious rooms, great food and a truly fan-tas-tic staff?
YES!
We had a really good stay here, with an excellent price/quality ratio!
Highly recommended!
title: Highly recommended!

text:
We wanted to go somewhere local for our Honeymoon and somehow Seerock got added to our Honeymoon hotel lists. My wife and I decided to visit the Seerock hotel, initially we were hesitant about our choice and after going through so many reviews and videos of this place, we thought of giving it a shot.

My oh my, It was the best 4 days. Where should i start from, We loved the Hotel's architecture and the Superior King Deluxe room we stayed was beautiful with an added Jacuzzi bath . The Seerock Team was very kind to us and they pampered us throughout our trip. We got a pretty good deal with Feelo which came with Fullboard and a free Safari ride. The food was delicious , Kudos to the Chef and the Team. As a whole, It was one of the best trip we had and will recommend it to our family, friends and colleagues!
title: Trip like no other!

placeInfo: {'id': '10903452', 'name': "Seerock The King's Domain", 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 263, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.999112, 'longitude': 80.745415, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10903452-Reviews-Seerock_The_King_s_Domain-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://seerockthekingsdomain.com/', 'address': 'Indigawewa Sigiriya, Dambulla 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigawewa', 'street2': 'Sigiriya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 4, 'count4': 24, 'count5': 228}}
text:
Where do i start. It was a one of the relaxed weekends i had in a while.  I am so greatful to have stayed in Seerock which was a amazing little hotel with outstanding service to be offered. Away from city in the midst of total quietness is what anyone would ask for. 

Whoever read this review please feel free to check it out . I can 100% vouch for it.  

- Location - Easy to get by via Habarana. Once you are at Habarana you can reach the hotel via Tuk Tuk. Make sure to use Pick Me (Similar as Uber). Or you could even arrange a pick through the hotel who are happy to do the needful. 

Hotel is close to Sigiriya and Pidurangala as well which is a plus

Hotel was kind enough to arrange a Safari at Hurulu Park where we were lucky to see some Elephants at their own habitat. Tharanga (Safari Driver) was very well aware where to go so we would have the best experience. 

- First impression - We were welcomed by Shehara (Front Desk) witha big smile . Welcome drinks were offered & check in was pretty quick. 

- Room - A well maintained,  clean & luxurious little room with a  Jacuzzi built in . Belive me it was a perfect fit and its  suited for a family as well. 

- Food & Service- Chef Renuka and team are gifted with amazing skillset. Every dish they offered us was out of the world. 

Special shoutout to Daminda and Krishantha who served us through the stay was always happy to make sure we enjoyed each meal. 

Thank you Seerock The Kings Domain for the outstanding hospitality. This is the least I could do for the hospitality you offered. Looking for to see you next year.
title: Habarana's best place to be at (‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê)

placeInfo: {'id': '10903452', 'name': "Seerock The King's Domain", 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 263, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.999112, 'longitude': 80.745415, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10903452-Reviews-Seerock_The_King_s_Domain-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://seerockthekingsdomain.com/', 'address': 'Indigawewa Sigiriya, Dambulla 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigawewa', 'street2': 'Sigiriya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 4, 'count4': 24, 'count5': 228}}
roomTip: Don‚Äôt go to the hotel if you wanna try and international menu
text:
The room with the jacuzzi is great. It‚Äôs the only good thing about the hotel other than the staff. The room is actually a luxurious room but the water pressure was not that good. Also the jacuzzi wasn‚Äôt working really well. It leaked on our first night.

Pool had no view at all and the showers and the water feature was not working at all. Several pool tiles were also broken and there were many frogs inside the pool. Also it was not cleaned properly. There was no place to take nice pictures even. They‚Äôve ample place but not maintained properly. Landscaping is nil. Also horrible wifi 

Food was the worst we‚Äôve ever tried at any hotel. Don‚Äôt get fooled by the positive comments regarding the food. I‚Äôm pretty sure they‚Äôve not tried star hotels before. The menu was horrible. There was actually nothing to choose from. Menu needs to change and also only the local food was okay. Other than that pastas was horrible. I had a spaghetti bolognese and it was not a bolognese at all. They just served me noodles with beef and tomato slices ü§¶üèæ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è 

The worst thing is we booked the hotel on full board through another app with a discount. The management refused to serve us English breakfast because we booked it on a discount. It was not mentioned anywhere at all. Also it‚Äôs very poor to treat different customers in a different way. 

The only silver lining is Shehara who tried her best to give us an enjoyable vacation but this was a disastrous vacation. 

Again what I have to say is don‚Äôt be fooled by the pictures or positive comments
title: Don‚Äôt get fooled by the positive comments. Horrible food and experience

roomTip: Go elsewhere‚Ä¶ there are so many hotels in the same area.
text:
Beautiful large rooms with jacuzzi that we couldn‚Äôt use as the water pressure was terribly slow. It would take 1 hour to fill the bath.
Staff super kind but they stole my iPad and $125 from the suitcase. I put all the valuable things in the safe (thank God) but left out the iPad and money that were in my suitcase (not on a desk or whatever). The staff opened my suitcase and did the job. There were 2 male cleaners who were cleaning the rooms. Just saying.
I emailed the manager 2 days later when I found out the items were missing and they couldn‚Äôt do anything about. They said that 2 days later was a long time after the departure. Really? I am on holiday and busy discovering places, I don‚Äôt have time to use my iPad every day.

Upon check out, the manager asked me to pay additional 2000Rupes for the driver‚Äôs accommodation which of course I refused to pay. Shocking. My driver had to step in and argue with the manager as this was going nowhere. Even the driver promised not to bring any tourist in that place by the way he was treated.

Worst hotel ever.

There are plenty hotels in the area.
Don‚Äôt get fooled by the price.
You‚Äôve been warned.
title: Don‚Äôt get fooled. Go elsewhere.

roomTip: Not for people with disabilities .
text: Comfortable well appointed rooms , but that‚Äôs it. Despite several emails they had not adhered to our request for a triple room. The food was probably the worst we‚Äôve ever had in any resort/ hotel anywhere in the world. The restaurant can only be accessed by climbing a very steep flight of stairs. Being disabled, this was impossible . I was told that the food could be brought to the room at an additional charge of Rs 1000 each meal! There was no pool attendant and the shower and water feature at the pool did not work. There was no way to communicate with the staff from the room. No phone. We were given a daily menu with 3 choices for each meal. There was no a la carte menu. For someone who cannot eat carbs, there were no options available. Dessert was a tiny square of ‚ÄúCr√®me caramel‚Äù  made from a packet !  Disgusting ! Indeed a great shame for a hotel with so much potential.

placeInfo: {'id': '10903452', 'name': "Seerock The King's Domain", 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 263, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.999112, 'longitude': 80.745415, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10903452-Reviews-Seerock_The_King_s_Domain-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://seerockthekingsdomain.com/', 'address': 'Indigawewa Sigiriya, Dambulla 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigawewa', 'street2': 'Sigiriya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 4, 'count4': 24, 'count5': 228}}
text:
I'm a frequent traveler and I was tempted to try out this hotel as I came across one of their offers. I called the hotel and checked their availability and placed a temporary booking. Then I confirmed the offer and made the payment and requested them to send the booking confirmation. 

I had been trying for 3 days to get a booking confirmation from them!!! But still had NO success. I travel a quite a lot and sending a booking confirmation is a matter of few minutes usually. I was surprised why it is taking them days to send a simple booking confirmation. I have made more than 10 calls over the past 3 days to ask for the booking. Also, to my surprise I found that the last few calls made to the landline were intentionally picked up and cancelled. (This is a FIRST in many of my travels).

Also, I had the feeling that the first female agent who picked up the reservation was clueless. She was not good in her English, so I spoke to her in Sinhalese. Whenever I inquired about the booking she will reply saying it will be sent shortly. But it never came in the first 3 days. What a waste of time!

Finally on the fourth day another reservation executive picks up the call and sends me a booking for a different set of days. I tried to call and ask them to correct it. But the hotel never picked up any of their phones.

So i finally decided to cancel the booking. 
I'm sure they have made a Blunder somewhere!!!
hence this reaction! 
I have seen hotels make mistakes before but the quality hotels always try to make amends and will usually try to check with the customer and correct it. This is a good sign of the lack of quality and lack of training of the staff. If the staff is this negligent and rude even prior to your arrival, I'm glad I didn't go there to find out!
title: Terrible Customer Service / Guest Handling / Not reliable

placeInfo: {'id': '12059634', 'name': 'Liyya Water Villas', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 349, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.784759, 'longitude': 80.64743, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d12059634-Reviews-Liyya_Water_Villas-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://web.facebook.com/liyyawatervillas/?_rdc=1&_rdr', 'address': 'Embulambe, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Embulambe', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 51, 'count5': 276}}
roomTip: Don‚Äôt bother booking here
text:
We booked into Liyya Water Villa‚Äôs for 5 nights in July with high expectations for the opportunity to relax for a day or two after a busy holiday.
On first impressions the villas are in an idyllic but very remote location which could be very peaceful.  Without any prior notice, we were subject to building work being completed in public areas. 3 feet away from the swimming pool/sunbeds and staff telling us they would be just unloading the truck, then half an hours work which after 2 hours they were still there. To then being told they would be 20mins. While this work was being done there was wood constantly being sawed, drilling and staple gunning. The men were video calling. Which in my swimwear made me very uncomfortable by the pool.
Alongside this the showers in our room were freezing cold and the internet didn‚Äôt work which made planning and booking anything for our trip impossible from our room or reception.
The food was average at best with little to no choice for breakfast. Which would make it very difficult if you were intolerant/vegetarian or vegan. 
Because of the remote location and area there is very little choice for food locally. So you are stuck at the restaurant in an evening again with little choice and one food menu per table, no matter your table size. With no drinks menu.
Liyya has the potential to be wonderful but has a long way to go to be 5 stars.
We were promised a refund for the 3 nights that we didn‚Äôt stay. And in October we are still waiting for our money back.
title: That bad we booked a new hotel

placeInfo: {'id': '12059634', 'name': 'Liyya Water Villas', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 349, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.784759, 'longitude': 80.64743, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d12059634-Reviews-Liyya_Water_Villas-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://web.facebook.com/liyyawatervillas/?_rdc=1&_rdr', 'address': 'Embulambe, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Embulambe', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 51, 'count5': 276}}
roomTip: Minor imperfections but take them in your stride and simply enjoy!
text: This hotel was the second on our recent tour of Sri Lanka and it was really lovely.  The design of the rooms around a central lake is charming with ducks and even a large Iguana type lizard.  Not to forget the monkeys of course that kept the staff busy chasing them away from the dining areas.  It's not just to lay-out that impresses but the rooms too.  They are modern, large and comfortable in every way.  Ours, the furthest away from the dining room and pool had a great view back towards the reception.  The staff were really thoughtful and helpful and the food was always exceptional.  Great place and wonderful memories.
title: Unexpected delight

placeInfo: {'id': '12059634', 'name': 'Liyya Water Villas', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 349, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.784759, 'longitude': 80.64743, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d12059634-Reviews-Liyya_Water_Villas-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://web.facebook.com/liyyawatervillas/?_rdc=1&_rdr', 'address': 'Embulambe, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Embulambe', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 51, 'count5': 276}}
text: The service rendered by the F& B staff and the reception staff was very good. They were warm, kind and helpful. The room was comfortable, spacious and clean. However, the food was just average. In summary, the excellent service given by the staff made up to it.

placeInfo: {'id': '12059634', 'name': 'Liyya Water Villas', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 349, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.784759, 'longitude': 80.64743, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d12059634-Reviews-Liyya_Water_Villas-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://web.facebook.com/liyyawatervillas/?_rdc=1&_rdr', 'address': 'Embulambe, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Embulambe', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 51, 'count5': 276}}
roomTip: Check your locker thoroughly before you check out !!
text: We stayed ay Liyya Water Villas for 3 nights recently on our tour of SriLanka...We had booked 05 Villas...rooms were spacious & clean ...Check in was smooth...Ambience was fab with a big pond in the center with friendly ducks...Food was yummy...I had left behind my credit & debit cards by mistake in my room 103 in the locker & moved to the next destination with my friends...they contacted me with photo of my cards & on my request immediately couriered the cards to our Travel Agents in Colombo who handed over the cards to me on receipt....Iam Grateful for the quick & efficient response from hotel team
title: Great Stay

placeInfo: {'id': '12059634', 'name': 'Liyya Water Villas', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 349, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.784759, 'longitude': 80.64743, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d12059634-Reviews-Liyya_Water_Villas-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://web.facebook.com/liyyawatervillas/?_rdc=1&_rdr', 'address': 'Embulambe, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Embulambe', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 51, 'count5': 276}}
text:
I had a pleasant stay at Liyya water villa and I‚Äôd like to express my gratitude to the staff for their outstanding hospitality. From the moment I arrived, the team was warm, welcoming, and always ready to help with any request. Special thanks to Mr. Rathnayaka and Anusha in restaurant , Samanthi in room maintenance and Hashini the receptionist for going the extra mile to ensure I had everything I needed.

The room was clean, comfortable, and well-maintained, which made my stay enjoyable. The location was also perfect and I appreciated the convenience of nearby attractions.

However, I believe there‚Äôs some room for improvement in the food section.I felt that the variety and freshness of some items could be enhanced. A bit more attention to the quality of ingredients and perhaps expanding the menu would really elevate the dining experience.

Overall, I had a great stay, and I look forward to visiting again. Thank you to the entire team for making my trip memorable!
title: Had a wonderful experience

placeInfo: {'id': '12059634', 'name': 'Liyya Water Villas', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 349, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.784759, 'longitude': 80.64743, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d12059634-Reviews-Liyya_Water_Villas-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://web.facebook.com/liyyawatervillas/?_rdc=1&_rdr', 'address': 'Embulambe, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Embulambe', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 51, 'count5': 276}}
roomTip: Wonderful stay!
text: This is a beautiful, luxurious hotel in a peaceful location. The rooms are wonderful with modern interiors, and the setting is picturesque as all of the villas face into a pretty lake. There are plenty of friendly birds to see in the surroundings, and you can swim in the pool while having a magnificent view of the lake. Food is delicious with plenty of choice on offer (both Sri Lankan and western) and staff are  brilliantly supportive ensuring that guests are happy and content. It was a truly unforgettable stay for myself and my family and we look forward to our next magical visit to Liyya Water Villas!
title: Amazing family holiday

placeInfo: {'id': '12059634', 'name': 'Liyya Water Villas', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 349, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.784759, 'longitude': 80.64743, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d12059634-Reviews-Liyya_Water_Villas-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://web.facebook.com/liyyawatervillas/?_rdc=1&_rdr', 'address': 'Embulambe, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Embulambe', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 51, 'count5': 276}}
text: The villas were stunning.  Beautiful architecture.  Absolutely amazing location around a small lake with ducks about it. Pool was great with the family. We had drinks by the pool all to ourselves. Was a great base to go to sigiriya, to dambullah caves and the elephant safari was fantastic. Loved it here. And even a chess board in the room to play a few games. The staff were very friendly and helpful - Ratnayake was very attentive and helpful at the restaurant through out. A great place to stay.
title: Stunning villas around a lake and pool

placeInfo: {'id': '12059634', 'name': 'Liyya Water Villas', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 349, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.784759, 'longitude': 80.64743, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d12059634-Reviews-Liyya_Water_Villas-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://web.facebook.com/liyyawatervillas/?_rdc=1&_rdr', 'address': 'Embulambe, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Embulambe', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 51, 'count5': 276}}
text:
Our stay at Liyya Water Villas was short but delightful! From the moment we arrived, we were warmly welcomed by Susantha, who went out of his way to ensure our comfort. Dinner was a quiet affair, but the Sri Lankan food was some of the best we had on our entire trip‚Äîan authentic feast bursting with incredible flavors.

Our room was impressively spacious, featuring a super comfy bed and a charming outdoor seating area where we were greeted by adorable local wildlife, including ducks and friendly dogs. The place had a wonderfully homely and safe vibe, making our stay truly special.
title: Experiencing Nature at Liyya

placeInfo: {'id': '12059634', 'name': 'Liyya Water Villas', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 349, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.784759, 'longitude': 80.64743, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d12059634-Reviews-Liyya_Water_Villas-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://web.facebook.com/liyyawatervillas/?_rdc=1&_rdr', 'address': 'Embulambe, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Embulambe', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 51, 'count5': 276}}
roomTip: Get up early morning and come to the ground you can watch many birds and hear their calls
text: Sigiriya and Dabulla is a very beautiful tourist paradise in Sri Lanka, my daughter, son and wife stayed at Liyya Water Villa for one day and I was very surprised when I saw this hotel while driving along a gravel road surrounded by forest. All the trees and plants at the hotel were growing with proper nutrition. Well maintained lake with tamed ducks gives a fabulous look. We were greeted at the entrance by the friendly receptionists Hashani and Nisansala, it is a extrem welcome. A highly maintained family room  was provided for the family with two king size beds and luxurious ameities.  Tremendous effort had taken by house keepers to maintained the washrooms in mint conditions and it is not an easy task with area provincial water but they have done, housekeeping staff were very friendly and well-trained, especially Ratnayake and Samanthi among them. The food was prepared and presented at a very high level and delicious, it is a very beautiful and high standard hotel, all this credit should go to the General Manager, Mr. Mahesh Dhammapathfor his bold leadership so I hereby give my respect to him. If anyone travels Sigiriya this is the no 01 hotel to stay to get plus plus experience which you never get it from anyone.... All the very best Mahesh and the team.
title: One of the best friendly staff, well maintained environment with tantalizing food and best place to stay.

placeInfo: {'id': '12059634', 'name': 'Liyya Water Villas', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 349, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.784759, 'longitude': 80.64743, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d12059634-Reviews-Liyya_Water_Villas-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://web.facebook.com/liyyawatervillas/?_rdc=1&_rdr', 'address': 'Embulambe, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Embulambe', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 51, 'count5': 276}}
text:
My wife and I had a wonderful stay at Liyya Water Villas. The staff were fantastic, greeting us warmly right from the entrance. The security personnel, front desk, room service, and restaurant staff were all exceptionally courteous and professional.

The hotel itself is very calm, and our cabana room offered good privacy. The presence of friendly ducks around the property added a delightful touch to the experience. The food was excellent, with a good variety to choose from, and the swimming pool was also great.

However, I feel there could be some additional activities available at the hotel. It would be nice to have options such as bicycle rides, a spa, gym, library, and maybe an indoor game area.

Additionally, the rooms could be improved with a larger TV, and the bathroom would benefit from having a bathtub.

Overall, it was a lovely stay, and we look forward to seeing these enhancements in the future.
title: Great Experience, but Room for Improvement

text:
The little cottages by the side of a little lake occupied by little creatures like ducks was the first thing that made me decide on the venue. 
The warmest welcome and the comfy surrounding helped us settle down really fast. 
The swing by the lake and the narrow path on which my little girl rode her bicycle gave the perfect entertainment for her.
A stay is never complete without a splash in the pool. The pool has a picturesque setting and ideal for perfect pictures. 
If looking for a serene place to relax and calm down from the chaotic busy schedules, this is an idea destination!!!
title: A day by a little lake!

placeInfo: {'id': '5980996', 'name': 'Kalundewa Retreat', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 323, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.796857, 'longitude': 80.67624, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d5980996-Reviews-Kalundewa_Retreat-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.kalundewaretreat.com', 'address': 'Kalundewa Road Dambulu Oya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kalundewa Road', 'street2': 'Dambulu Oya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 54, 'count5': 243}}
text:
The concept of the hotel as a retreat is very nice. Huuuge property with beautiful nature everywhere you look, which you can explore by the free-to-use bikes they offer. The view from our room into the nature and to tge mountain was beautiful.  We liked the architecture of the rooms and the restaurant area with the window facades. We also liked that there was no music in the restaurant area to be able to enjoy the sound of the wind, trees and animals (especially birds). Also, as the hotel has only nine rooms in total, you have a lot of privacy. Actually my friend and I have only seen two other guests one time at dinner but had the pool all to ourselves (but we have to say that we have been there during low season). The staff of the hotel is very friendly and attentive. If you have any wishes/needs they are happy to assist you with anything (e.g. the FO manager helped us to book the train from Kandy to Ella). The best feature of the hotel for us was the food, which was included in our room price for 2 nights. For breakfast they have  a Sri Lankan option and a western option (we chose the latter and enjoyed omelette and nice fruits and sweets). Dinner was excellent the two nights. Well-thought 4 course menus that are changing every day, including starter, soup, main course and desert. Every course was a gusto. Also they cook a lot with their own grown plants from the garden and you can really taste the difference between these fresh nutritious meals and the frozen fish and vegetables in Germany.  We really LOVED the food. 
The only thing we would improve is the maintenance of the hotel. The walls, windows and the pool could be cleaner. Also the sun loungers could be renewed as well as the bikes and the roof covers. 
If maintenance and restoration in the hotel would be improved, it is without doubt an amazing place.
Just a little tip on the side: the time we were there it was very windy, especially during the night. The wind was very loud and the roof cover made noises due to the wind. So if you are noise-sensitive and can‚Äôt sleep when it‚Äôs too loud, better bring ear plugs ü´†üôÇ
title: Very calm place to stay a little outside of dambulla with delicious food and lots of privacy

placeInfo: {'id': '5980996', 'name': 'Kalundewa Retreat', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 323, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.796857, 'longitude': 80.67624, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d5980996-Reviews-Kalundewa_Retreat-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.kalundewaretreat.com', 'address': 'Kalundewa Road Dambulu Oya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kalundewa Road', 'street2': 'Dambulu Oya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 54, 'count5': 243}}
text:
This is the most awesome place I have stayed. 
Large area of beautifully tended paddy fields, several very different lakes and paths throughout the grounds to walk or cycle. There are 9 rooms across different properties dotted around the grounds. All are very private. 

We stayed  as a family of 4 in the Bakmee  house (upper and lower) . It is right on a lake and the bird life is phenomenal. We had white egret, black headed ibis and hornbills filling 3 of the trees at roosting time only a couple of metres off our decking. The sound was amazing. There were lots of other birds but also water monitors, turtles, huge fruit bats, peacocks ,monkeys‚Ä¶.. and more. 
The building was an amazing architectural piece. We felt very lucky that this was our accommodation as we hadn‚Äôt specifically chosen a room. The building is very modern and nearly  all glass so we felt very close to nature all the time. It is well air conditioned and the rooms are beautiful; glass walled, so looking straight out to nature sitting in bed when the blinds are up.

The whole estate is absolutely stunning. Cycling and walking round was fabulous and so peaceful with lots of wildlife to spot. 
The food is very good with a large menu. The service at dinner was very friendly and attentive. We took breakfast in our house which felt very luxurious. The breakfasts were vast and very tasty. 

The only down side is it needed a good clean. The blinds are old and patterned with squashed insects and we even had a ‚Äòpressed gecko‚Äô! It has the appearance of having had a quick wipe round only rather than cleaning the corners of rooms, behind the sinks, the mirrors etc. There is an unusable outside ?shower or ? Bath. This is not clean at all and was rather unwelcoming. The inside shower is very good though. The huge panes of glass are dirty from the first floor up in the cathedral living area. I appreciate cleaning these higher pane would be hard. The utilities store for the cleaners is enroute to the main entrance of the property ; the door ajar and smells. Several features need some maintenance like faulty electrical blinds and leaking taps. Servicing of the room and clearing breakfast was intermittent and variable and the plunge pool cleaning had to be requested. We were not informed about the full potential of the place - like a separate large swimming pool at the far side of the estate or what activities we could do there- kayaking, lake boat ride etc 

Despite my negative comments above I would be back like a shot as it was the most surreal setting I‚Äôve even been in.
It would be fabulous if the other reviews had been actioned with improvements to the general cleaning and maintenance to showcase this venue to its full potential. 

Come and stay if you like a beautiful,quiet, very different setting,very close to nature.  I suspect the experience would be very different in each of the properties here as they are all very different and situated at different parts of the estate.
title: Close to nature, a stunning location

placeInfo: {'id': '5980996', 'name': 'Kalundewa Retreat', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 323, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.796857, 'longitude': 80.67624, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d5980996-Reviews-Kalundewa_Retreat-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.kalundewaretreat.com', 'address': 'Kalundewa Road Dambulu Oya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kalundewa Road', 'street2': 'Dambulu Oya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 54, 'count5': 243}}
roomTip: Make sure you check with the management of the condition of the rooms.
text:
We picked this hotel to spend the last two days of our 7-day trip in the area, so we were expecting a relaxing and luxurious experience.

We were pleasantly surprised to find that management had upgraded our room from Lower Bakmee to Kumbuk chalet, considering our privacy and the low occupancy during our booking dates.

We found the staff to be very attentive, helpful, and they were eager to make our stay more enjoyable. They also sent us a cake to our room for our anniversary. Special credit goes to the kitchen staff. The food was really delicious and presented beautifully. 

The hotel premises offer many stunning views and we felt like we were living in a village, disconnected from all the busyness outside. As nature lovers, we really enjoyed watching various kinds of birds on the premise and taking walks on the nature trails.

However, we must emphasize that the chalet was not up to a satisfactory level. The bed linens looked old (discolored), and the same goes for the towels as well. The bathroom area was the biggest disappointment. We found it very unpleasant during our stay due to the it‚Äôs dirtiness. Even the plunge pool outside was not clean. 

We believe that unless the management does a proper renovation and deep cleaning of this chalet (Kumbuk chalet) , it should not be given to visitors even at a discounted price. Moreover, the management should explain the condition of the rooms before accepting reservations.
title: Mixed feelings

placeInfo: {'id': '5980996', 'name': 'Kalundewa Retreat', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 323, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.796857, 'longitude': 80.67624, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d5980996-Reviews-Kalundewa_Retreat-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.kalundewaretreat.com', 'address': 'Kalundewa Road Dambulu Oya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kalundewa Road', 'street2': 'Dambulu Oya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 54, 'count5': 243}}

text:
Nestled in a serene and peaceful area, Kalundewa Retreat offers a tranquil retreat away from the hustle and bustle. The staff's hospitality exceeded my expectations, with their attentiveness and warm demeanor enhancing my overall experience. The food surpassed all expectations, with each dish being a culinary masterpiece. Without a doubt, I wholeheartedly recommend for those seeking a tranquil getaway with impeccable service and exceptional dining.

Extra activities: cycling, kayaking 

Unfortunately, all the footage I have are videos and cannot be uploaded :(
title: Taking peace to a whole new level

placeInfo: {'id': '5980996', 'name': 'Kalundewa Retreat', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 323, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.796857, 'longitude': 80.67624, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d5980996-Reviews-Kalundewa_Retreat-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.kalundewaretreat.com', 'address': 'Kalundewa Road Dambulu Oya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kalundewa Road', 'street2': 'Dambulu Oya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 54, 'count5': 243}}
text:
Exceptional experience hidden away in a middle of a small lake and paddy fields. We stayed one night in the Lower Bakmee which includes the private jacuzzi where we spent most of our time. 

Staff were amazing and well experienced. Food was great, we enjoyed each meal served to the room as we requested. 

The only downside is, the rooms need some renovations. Regular cleaning was good but it needs some major deep clean to bring it up to its original glory. 

Overall a great stay in a star class resort.
title: Great stay in the star class resort

placeInfo: {'id': '5980996', 'name': 'Kalundewa Retreat', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 323, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.796857, 'longitude': 80.67624, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d5980996-Reviews-Kalundewa_Retreat-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.kalundewaretreat.com', 'address': 'Kalundewa Road Dambulu Oya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kalundewa Road', 'street2': 'Dambulu Oya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 54, 'count5': 243}}
text:

Devaka and Raneesha
title: Ultimate Relaxation

text: We stayed in Kalundewa Retreat for 5 days in a private villa. It‚Äôs not easy to describe our experience in few words but this was a paradise where we we lost ourselves in wonders of nature and thoroughly enjoyed the Sri Lankan hospitality. Very special thanks to Kanth and Samarasiri who are true ambassadors of this property. We have already planned our next trip to Kalundewa
title: Experience true wonders of natute

placeInfo: {'id': '5980996', 'name': 'Kalundewa Retreat', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 323, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.796857, 'longitude': 80.67624, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d5980996-Reviews-Kalundewa_Retreat-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.kalundewaretreat.com', 'address': 'Kalundewa Road Dambulu Oya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kalundewa Road', 'street2': 'Dambulu Oya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 54, 'count5': 243}}
text:
You need to book the rooms with the plunge pool as these are built in water. you can really do bird watching and it is really peace-full. we enjoyed sleeping the curtains opened (not the windows - small insects) in the night the silhouette of the trees and the nature is a view we didn't experience in any other place.
Food is not good! they really need to get a good chef.
title: One of a kind room and experience of Nature

placeInfo: {'id': '5980996', 'name': 'Kalundewa Retreat', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 323, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.796857, 'longitude': 80.67624, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d5980996-Reviews-Kalundewa_Retreat-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.kalundewaretreat.com', 'address': 'Kalundewa Road Dambulu Oya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kalundewa Road', 'street2': 'Dambulu Oya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 54, 'count5': 243}}
roomTip: There are only nine rooms/chalets on this 110-acre property so book in advance to secure your reservation.
text: We will remember our stay at this retreat with great fondness. Our room was located in the middle of paddy fields and had a view of the mountains. The operations manager Mr. Samarasiri was extremely warm, welcoming, and attentive to our needs. We enjoyed the food prepared to perfection with vegetables and herbs from the organic garden. If you love birds, this is the place for you. There are several peacocks here that lend beauty to the environment. There can‚Äôt be a better place to unwind and relax.
title: Living in tandem with nature

placeInfo: {'id': '5980996', 'name': 'Kalundewa Retreat', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 323, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.796857, 'longitude': 80.67624, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d5980996-Reviews-Kalundewa_Retreat-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.kalundewaretreat.com', 'address': 'Kalundewa Road Dambulu Oya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kalundewa Road', 'street2': 'Dambulu Oya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 54, 'count5': 243}}
text: What can I say about this place, if you want a get away from it all experience in amongst nature then this is the place.  Only 9 rooms scattered over 150 acres of rice fields, lakes and trees.  The rice fields are leased to locals. Lovely walks in complete peace amongst an array of birds and monkeys. At 6pm hundreds of birds descend on the trees in the lakes to bed down for the night, it‚Äôs a sight to be seen and heard. All you can hear are birds, it was a refreshing sound after hearing traffic everyday back home.  Bear in mind you are in fields with nature and nature sometimes pays a visit! The food especially the variety of soups at this retreat were the best we‚Äôve had.
title: At Peace with Nature

placeInfo: {'id': '5980996', 'name': 'Kalundewa Retreat', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 323, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.796857, 'longitude': 80.67624, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d5980996-Reviews-Kalundewa_Retreat-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.kalundewaretreat.com', 'address': 'Kalundewa Road Dambulu Oya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kalundewa Road', 'street2': 'Dambulu Oya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 54, 'count5': 243}}
text:
The architecture, the layout of the property is truly special and beautiful. The ethos of blending the hotel into its environs leads to a very special experience. From everywhere in out Chalet we felt like we were outdoor. The people servicing the place are very efficient and good.

However I visited the property after many years and it‚Äôs a bit run down. You expect top notch ‚Äúeverything‚Äù at this cost - but the outdoor shower was dirty. The matter too springy. The sofa covers in the main areas all stained. 
The food was strictly okay 
It‚Äôs in need of an upgradation and re-haul to bring it back to the level of being the best property in Dambulla
title: Lovely but in need of a re-haul

ownerResponse: {'id': '963412512', 'text': 'It is our pleasure to hear your valuable feedback', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-08-06', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}
placeInfo: {'id': '8655826', 'name': 'Rangiri Dambulla Resort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 381, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.848332, 'longitude': 80.6345, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d8655826-Reviews-Rangiri_Dambulla_Resort-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://rangiridambullaresort.lsrhotels.com', 'address': 'Pohoran Wewa, Kurunegala Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Pohoran Wewa, Kurunegala Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 70, 'count5': 298}}
text:
We had a nice stay here. 

We received a friendly welcome with fresh juice drinks, flowers and a candle lighting ceremony. 

The resort is set back from the busy road in a peaceful garden oasis. 

There is a large organic garden which the hotel uses for home grown produce. 

We were invited to join a mango tree planting ceremony to celebrate 9 years of business and we were privileged to be part of this. We were shown around the garden, then harvested okra and cassava and had a simple but very tasty lunch cooked with these ingredients in the garden on a simple stove and served wrapped in banana leaf. What a lovely experience! 

The accommodation is a series of lodges around the garden. They are large, clean and comfortable. We did have squirrels in the roof and a few droppings in the room as a consequence but didn‚Äôt find this to be a problem. This was a result of being in area with abundant wildlife which was lovely.

The location is a good base for Dambulla caves and not too far from Sigiriya and national parks for elephant watching.

Dambulla is a busy commercial centre with a 24hr wholesale market - one afternoon my husband ventured in to take a look around for a few hours and returned by tuk tuk. I chose to stay and relax by the pool with our children.

We had a very enjoyable visit to the cricket stadium one evening for the Women‚Äôs T20 Asia cup which happened to be on and offering free entry to promote support. 

The hotel staff were friendly but unfortunately we did find them a little inattentive when we were on site. For example, we spent a fair amount of time relaxing around the pool and no-one came to ask if we wanted drinks or snacks. Of course we could have gone and asked but to be offered would have been nicer and I think reasonable to expect in a higher end hotel, especially as we appeared to be the only guests on site that day! 
Pool towels were not offered until nearly the end if the day. 
In addition pool towels left from other guests on the previous day were not cleared away - I tidied these up myself! I do think the staff may have been distracted by the owner who was visiting that day ü§î but ‚Ä¶. 

Unfortunately I also have to say the food was disappointing. Meals were buffet format. The food was mostly cold and quite bland. We ate out for 2 out of the 3 nights due to this - there is quite a good restaurant just a few hundred metres up the road. 

Finally - a poor touch as we checked out was a staff member following my husband to the tip box to ensure he made a tip and then signalling to colleagues how much he‚Äôd placed in the box. Not very polite and certainly not classy!

Overall I can say we had an enjoyable and relaxing stay in a peaceful garden oasis. The staff were kind and friendly but there‚Äôs a bit of room for improvement in a few areas.
title: A nice resort hotel with peaceful garden. Staff friendly. Unfortunately food not great.

text: The staff went out of their way to make it a special experience. Super friendly and attentive, fixed issues quickly, super food, and even some fascinating cultural experiences too (eg staff showing us traditional dance and letting us take part in food preparation). Lots of wildlife to see on-site too. A great base for local adventures. The elephant safari is amazing and the cricket stadium is very close (we saw a Lankan premier league match). Fairly limited onsite facilities for children - there is an outdoor pool - but the staff played cricket with us, which was a real highlight for the kids. Overall lots of lovely memories and left feeling like royalty.
title: The staff make it a wonderful experience

Thank you Dinesh and thank you to your entire team.

Rina and Patrick

Good hotel overall. 

Rooms were nice looking and all electronics worked properly.

Staff is very friendly and the food is of good quality and variety. Make sure you bring the exact amount of money for paying your drinks however because change seems to always be taken as tip by the waiter. Unless you don‚Äôt mind him taking the change as tip, we didn‚Äôt mind it too much since it was little but still weird they didn‚Äôt ask if it was okay.

Be prepared for a lot of insects, they‚Äôre everywhere. We had at least 20 insects entering our room even tho we tried to block any gaps in the windows / doors with towels and anything we could find. If you hate bugs it‚Äôs best to avoid.
title: Good hotel if you don‚Äôt mind bugs

text: Amazing place to relax in the middle of Dambulla. The location is simply ideal, surrounded by serene nature yet conveniently close to local attractions. The staff is amazing and attentive. They are really helpful with everything and do amazing cocktails :) Rooms are up to date and very modern. At breakfast they offer a variety of options to choose from. Would definitely stay here again!

text: Anybody knows those ruin - bars in Budapest? This place's atmosphere is similar to them, but in a tropical surroundings in Sri Lanka. Here everything is possible. If you want drink a cocktail while sitting in the pool, even late at night, if you want to choose a mild curry or a hot - as - a - hell one, one thing is sure: the staff will do everything for your sake! They are ready for a chat anytime, a friendly, youth - hearted place!
title: Delicious dishes near the pool

placeInfo: {'id': '2372292', 'name': 'Sundaras Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1335, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.854837, 'longitude': 80.652466, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d2372292-Reviews-Sundaras_Resort_Spa-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.sundaras.com/', 'address': '189 Kandy Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '189 Kandy Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 71, 'count2': 68, 'count3': 146, 'count4': 248, 'count5': 802}}
text:
As a group of 4, we decided to go for dinner at the Sundaras resort. The staff really looked after us, the food was good and the beer cold.
In chatting with Siddu, about the best things to do, we ended up booking two tours, the sunrise walk up Pidurangala rock and an afternoon elephant safari. Even though we were staying at a different hotel, he arranged pickup etc. all at a really good price.
We were picked up from our hotel at 5.45 prompt both TK our guide and proceeded to Pidurangala rock, admission was 1000 or 2000LKR each. The climb was steps at first and some serious scrambling near the top. The walk, with maybe 1000 others, including rests and queuing for the difficult parts took about 30 to 40 mins. TK did the walk with us and helped us and others along the way. At the top we had the most spectacular views of sunrise and lion rock, the walk back in daylight was easier than going up in the dark.
Following on, we had a really nice breakfast in a small 'locals' restaurant and then visited the reservoir, dropped back at our accommodation. TK was fantastic as a guide and a person .
Next was the elephant safari, Thilina our guide and driver was excellent, he was very safe a careful, knowledgeable and took many short detours to places he thought the elephants may be. In total we saw 48 elephants, some only a few weeks old, to the very big ones. It was a fantastic trip, with a great guide / driver. Highly recommend this tour, it was 6 hours of pleasure and learning.
We got back to our hotel to find a couple who had been quoted more for the two of them to do the safari than we paid for four people for the both trips.
Needless to s at we returned the next day to eat and drink at the Sundaras.
Thank you Siddu, TK and Thilina
title: The best food drink and excursions

placeInfo: {'id': '2372292', 'name': 'Sundaras Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1335, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.854837, 'longitude': 80.652466, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d2372292-Reviews-Sundaras_Resort_Spa-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.sundaras.com/', 'address': '189 Kandy Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '189 Kandy Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 71, 'count2': 68, 'count3': 146, 'count4': 248, 'count5': 802}}
text: A really lovely vibe at this place, with a great pool area with rustic seating areas and lots of trees around. Fantastic location for the nearby Dambulla Cave Temple. Very friendly and helpful staff, tasty meals and comfortable rooms with great spacious balconies. Just two things needed for five star review - mosquito repellent in rooms and a generator needed for occasional power cuts, which happened once during our stay. But overall, highly recommended.
title: Great vibe and friendly staff

placeInfo: {'id': '2372292', 'name': 'Sundaras Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1335, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.854837, 'longitude': 80.652466, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d2372292-Reviews-Sundaras_Resort_Spa-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.sundaras.com/', 'address': '189 Kandy Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '189 Kandy Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 71, 'count2': 68, 'count3': 146, 'count4': 248, 'count5': 802}}
roomTip: It‚Äôs a half built resort
text:
We didn‚Äôt stay here but went for a few beers after looking at their website. 
The bar area is dilapidated, we did not use the pool as filtration system was turned off and only turned on when a few more people turned up. 
We asked for a drinks menu and were told we would have to wait for the bar person who then turned up and stated he didn‚Äôt have one. When I asked the price he said you will have to pay at reception so never got a price until I went to reception. They only thought we had had 4 beers but being honest I said no it was 6, ¬£25 later I wish I had kept my mouth shut. Honesty can sometimes be a double edge sword. 
It‚Äôs certainly not 4star even at Sri Lanka standards
title: Needs serious refurbishment

placeInfo: {'id': '649489', 'name': 'Sigiriana Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 851, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.822019, 'longitude': 80.654755, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d649489-Reviews-Sigiriana_Resort-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://sigirianaresort.com/', 'address': '51 Godawalayaya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '51 Godawalayaya', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 38, 'count2': 31, 'count3': 104, 'count4': 306, 'count5': 372}}
text: It was a long walk to our room in one of the villas through lovely gardens with signs giving information about the plants. The room was showing its age and lack of cleaning. Some of the powerpoints looked grubby as did some tiles/grouting in the bathroom. Towels were off-white (as were the sheets) and far from new. At least the hot water was really hot. The door to the patio didn‚Äôt close completely, so no wonder there were insects in the room. One chair on the patio was missing a slat so it couldn‚Äôt be sat on comfortably. The food was good. We couldn‚Äôt see the point in having dinner on the BBQ terrace (grass) when it was not a barbeque. The final straw was being shown to a breakfast table with crumbs on the plate and tablecloth. When I complained, we were shown to another table with not only crumbs but stains from the previous night‚Äôs dinner. While this table was cleaned no attempt was made to clean the first one. We were at breakfast early, so we knew the tables had not been cleaned from the previous night.
title: Not 4 star

placeInfo: {'id': '649489', 'name': 'Sigiriana Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 851, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.822019, 'longitude': 80.654755, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d649489-Reviews-Sigiriana_Resort-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://sigirianaresort.com/', 'address': '51 Godawalayaya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '51 Godawalayaya', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 38, 'count2': 31, 'count3': 104, 'count4': 306, 'count5': 372}}
text: During my visit to Sri Lanka, I stayed at various hotels, but this one stood out as one of the best. From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed with fresh-smelling wet towels and refreshing mango juice. The rooms were impeccably clean, and the staff were exceptionally kind and friendly, attending to our requests promptly. The variety of delicious food was impressive. The hotel is situated in a quiet area, surrounded by extensive gardens and greenery. I definitely recommend it!
title: Unforgettable Hotel Stay in Sri Lanka

placeInfo: {'id': '649489', 'name': 'Sigiriana Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 851, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.822019, 'longitude': 80.654755, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d649489-Reviews-Sigiriana_Resort-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://sigirianaresort.com/', 'address': '51 Godawalayaya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '51 Godawalayaya', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 38, 'count2': 31, 'count3': 104, 'count4': 306, 'count5': 372}}
text:
This was our favourite hotel of the trip! Our family of 4 were separated into two huge rooms by a balcony so we were easily able to spend time in each others rooms. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. 
We used the swimming pool on a couple of occasions and my children enjoyed watching the birds and widlife whilst in the water! I indulged in a spa treatment that was also very nice. 
The restaurant had plenty to choose from and also had wonderful views over the paddy fields. Plenty of wildlife to spot including giant squirrels, Lizards, palm squirrels and birds. 
Thank you so much for a wonderful start to our holiday!
title: Wonderful start to our tour!

text:
This property is the same as 'Sigiriana Resort by Thilanka'. The staff were warm and hospitable. Room was spacious and had a nice view of the garden from the balcony. Food was average and can definitely be better.  Was disappointed to see no vegetarian desserts (other than papaya, watermelon & guava) & when I pointed this to the chef, he was kind enough to arrange something for me - a mango : )
The pool, as mentioned by several others, is the highlight.
title: Serene surroundings

Fantastic 10 day stay; this is a beautiful hotel with exceptional staff. text:
Anantara Kaluthara Resort is a true gem, offering a stunning blend of natural beauty and luxurious comfort. The resort's idyllic setting, with its lush greenery and serene lagoon, creates a tranquil atmosphere that is perfect for relaxation and rejuvenation.
The hotel staff, particularly Ms. Diani Thilakarathne, went above and beyond to ensure our stay was exceptional. Her informative tour and warm hospitality made us feel truly welcome. Despite the multiple corporate events, she dedicated extra time and effort to make our holiday memorable. It's clear that Anantara is fortunate to have such dedicated and passionate employees.
We also want to commend Mr. Nuwan Tharanga for his outstanding service. He promptly addressed a payment issue related to our online booking, providing excellent guidance and support throughout the process.
While the resort itself is magnificent, it's the exceptional service that truly sets Anantara Kaluthara apart. We highly recommend this resort to anyone seeking a luxurious and unforgettable getaway.
[5 out of 5 stars]
title: Anantara Kaluthara Resort: A Serene Oasis with Exceptional Service

text:
Anuntara Kalutara is heaven on earth. The resort is beautiful and completely at one with nature.

The staff could not have been more helpful and attentive, and a special thank you to Krish (host) for whom nothing was too much trouble.

The food was delicious - there are 3 restaurants: Olu (buffet), Aqualina (Italian) and Spice Traders (Asian fusion). Be warned, Aqualina and Spice Traders are open alternate days (at least when we were there), so plan on advance if you want to go.

We will definitely be returning to Anuntara Kalutara.
title: Heaven on Earth

placeInfo: {'id': '10154736', 'name': 'Anantara Kalutara Resort', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 2187, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.566024, 'longitude': 79.962555, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d10154736-Reviews-Anantara_Kalutara_Resort-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://kalutara.anantara.com', 'address': "St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka", 'addressObj': {'street1': "St. Sebastian's Road", 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 17, 'count2': 16, 'count3': 52, 'count4': 223, 'count5': 1879}}
text:
We had a lovely family holiday at the Anantara. Sri Lanka is a wonderful destination to combine a seaside holiday with some interesting stuff to do, and the Anantara was a great base for that. When we first got there after a short (90 minutes) drive from the airport it all seemed a little quiet and low key and I wasn't sure if we'd made the right choice, but as we relaxed into the rhythm of the place we enjoyed it more and more as the week went on.

The pool looks out over the lagoon so there are always things to see going on around the area while enjoying the water. There was quite a bit of rain the week that we were there but there was plenty to do in the hotel even when it was wet. For example we enjoyed playing pool in the upstairs bar and one day the manager arranged a lesson for our daughter in towel art conducted by our multi-talented room attendant Dilan. She also enjoyed an excellent, very professional art class with a lovely teacher called Rathna who came in specially from outside the hotel.

Our room was very spacious and well appointed. We tried all three restaurants, of which the Italian stood out as the best. Breakfast in the buffet was also very good as was the friendly service in the bar next to the buffet. The gym is of a high standard and well equipped.

Outside the hotel there is a small town with a well-stocked supermarket/liquor store about a twenty minute walk away on the main road. We met an autorickshaw driver called Freddy outside the hotel on our first day and he arranged a couple of interesting outings for us, one down the coast to Bentota for a boat trip and another to Richmond Castle, near which we also visited some spectacular waterfalls and a tea plantation. Freddy was a nice guy and charged reasonable prices, although he did insist on taking us to a slightly dodgy "spice garden" where the owner does a hard sell routine, from which Freddy no doubt earns some commission.

The only criticism I have of the hotel is that their prices for tours and activities were extremely high. This is not a huge issue though as it is easy enough to arrange your own.

Writing this makes me want to go back to Kalutara, and I hope we will one day.
title: Great base for a relaxing family holiday with interesting activities nearby

roomTip: Ideal if you want a get away weekend - a very tranquil setting with the beach and the lagoon on either side of the resort.
text:
What makes a place stand out is the personal touch to detail. We certainly experienced this at the Anantara Resort in Kalutara. Guests are greeted by female dancers dressed in traditional attire and one cannot help feel very special by this greeting as you enter the resort. Complimentary cold pressed face towels along with  hibiscus tea with a touch of cinnamon refresh you in the humidity. The ambience of the location is pure serenity and one has a choice of beach vs lagoon. Our room faced the ocean and watching the sunset was a treat from our own balcony. A walk around the premises offer some bird watching opportunities and the layout of the boardwalk embraces you along the lagoon. 
The catering staff have indeed learned how to attend to your culinary needs and tantalise your taste buds with suggestions from the buffet. We were made to feel at home amongst many guests and although our stay was for the weekend, we did feel a sense of connection with the staff who's smiles and approachability is unique to this resort. 
Our appreciation and thanks go to Mahesha who welcomed us so warmly and was very patient in answering our questions about our stay. Udeni, the hopper extraordinaire who made the crispiest hoppers, especially the most delicious pani hoppers I've had. To Kalana, Koshitha, Nadun, Anne and Deepak who were at our service when we needed verification about food preferences and fill ups of cold and warm water to keep hydrated. Our plates and cups were replenished with a great combination of food and I definitely would love to revisit this beautiful resort at some point in the future. 
Recommend this gem to those who simply want a place away from the bustle and hustle of city life...
title: A retreat to replenish your energy

placeInfo: {'id': '10154736', 'name': 'Anantara Kalutara Resort', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 2187, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.566024, 'longitude': 79.962555, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d10154736-Reviews-Anantara_Kalutara_Resort-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://kalutara.anantara.com', 'address': "St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka", 'addressObj': {'street1': "St. Sebastian's Road", 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 17, 'count2': 16, 'count3': 52, 'count4': 223, 'count5': 1879}}
text:
Over the last 33 years we have stayed in many different hotels, mainly five star, both in Colombo and throughout Sri Lanka.  The Anantara Kalutara rates very highly in our opinion and it is certainly one to which we would be very happy to return.

The staff have been charming, attentive and helpful, from management (Mr Lashan Liyange) right through to the helpful concierge Nuwan and even to Mr Eric Fernando for his professional attention, despite working for the adjacent Avani hotel. 
The Chefs and restaurant manager gave individual attention and provided both superbly displayed taster menus and wonderful traditional dishes.  Our thanks go to the staff of the Olu and the Acquolina restaurants where both the service and the food was superb.

The pool villa suite was excellent and the overall feeling within the hotel and grounds was one of quiet sophistication (it was the last hotel designed by the renowned architect Geoffrey Bawa).  Thank you for a very enjoyable eight days.

Tips: 
Maybe try to avoid national holidays, especially those coinciding with Poya (full moon holiday) as the hotel can become extremely busy (and, with live bands, somewhat noisy).
title: Another typically good Anantara Hotel.

text:
Went on a day trip with my extended family after booking for day packages and a day room. However, when we arrived there was no one at the front desk who was aware of the confirmed booking and  we were told to wait with many excuses given for why this booking was not known to them. Fortunately we had Ms. Nisansala come to our rescue. She quietly and competently sorted us out, apologised for the mistake and made sure we were taken care off though it did take the staff one hour to show us to our day room.

The chef in the restaurant was kind enought to take care of our request for vegetarian Sri lankan dishes to supplement the buffet which was curiously lacking in srilankan cuisine and vegetarian options.

But definitely the highlight of our trip was our interaction with the young server at our table, Mr Shamalan Perera who is a well spoken, cheerful and energetic young man who made sure to take care of every little need with diligence.

Anantara kalutara is one of my favourite day outing destinations with a lovely pool and has lovely large rooms. A happy surprise was that one could have good Nespresso coffee in the room with a machine provided. The room service was prompt and gracious.
title: Some gems in the service staff

roomTip: We booked in adept which is off season so the hotel was very quiet - which we liked. Never a problem at the restaurant or bar
text: The hotel was beautiful and the staff very attentive. The food was excellent with a wide variety of choice to suit all pallets. The room we had was over looking the ocean and while it was to rough to swim a walk on the beach was very pleasant. Lots of tuk-tuks available to take you to the local attractions like Richmond Castle and visits to local turtle rescue centre
title: Anantara recommended very highly

placeInfo: {'id': '316671', 'name': 'Mermaid Hotel & Club', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 3296, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.617478, 'longitude': 79.94547, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d316671-Reviews-Mermaid_Hotel_Club-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.mermaidhotelnclub.com/', 'address': 'Mahawaskaduwawa, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Mahawaskaduwawa', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 30, 'count2': 41, 'count3': 134, 'count4': 693, 'count5': 2398}}
text: I highly recommend Mermaid Hotel&Club! The service went above and beyond to make our stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. They were very friendly, helpful and smiling all the time! :) Meals were absolutely fantastic, diverse - both local and European. Rooms were being cleaned everyday and if we want, we can have second cleaning on the same day without additional charge. We have been given a plate of fresh fruits and local sweets as a welcome gift. The surroundings of the hotel are also very unique - there are various exotic trees and local species of fauna; you can have a feeling of sleeping in the middle of jungle because of sounds and colours aroud you. Moreover, you don't have to worry about your safety at all, because of the security guards which are on duty 24/7, making sure that your stay is not interrupted by any unexpected guests. I also took part in aerobics and yoga classes (no extra charge) with Mr Shiva, who made this experience even more memorable and fun! I would DEFINITELY come back here :)
title: Exquisite holidays

We had a great time here. The staff were amazing and so friendly. Special mention goes to Sam who looked after our room, Thank you Sam for all the flowers and towel sculptures. I also have to mention to the cheeky chappie who ensured our restaurant experience was top class, thank you. The food was great, always fresh and lots to choose from everyday. The beach was not so good and swimming in the sea was not allowed as the currents were too strong.
The hotel is very traditional and well located to give us a true experience of Sri Lanka. 
Thank you to everyone at the hotel who made us feel so welcome and our stay one to remember.
title: Very traditional.

{'id': '970985783', 'text': 'Dear Guest,

Thank you for sharing your feedback, and we regret that your experience at the Mermaid Hotel & Club did not meet your expectations. We take all guest concerns seriously and always aim to provide the best hospitality while maintaining the safety and security of everyone on our premises.

In this instance, our team, led by Duty Manager Sameera, acted in accordance with hotel policy, which is designed to prioritize guest safety and security. As per our policy, external visitors are not permitted in guest rooms for security reasons, but we made several alternative suggestions, including the use of our garden lounge and public spaces like the hotel lobby and bar. Despite this, we found the policy had not been respected, and we had to make the decision to ask external visitors to leave, ensuring the safety of all guests.

We understand that this situation may have been disappointing, but we hope you appreciate that our priority is always the safety and well-being of our guests. We value your feedback and hope to have the opportunity to welcome you again in the future under more favorable circumstances.

Warm regards,

Thomas Rodrigo', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-09-23', 'responder': 'Thomas Rodrigo', 'connectionToSubject': 'General Manager'}

placeInfo: {'id': '316671', 'name': 'Mermaid Hotel & Club', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 3296, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.617478, 'longitude': 79.94547, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d316671-Reviews-Mermaid_Hotel_Club-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.mermaidhotelnclub.com/', 'address': 'Mahawaskaduwawa, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Mahawaskaduwawa', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 30, 'count2': 41, 'count3': 134, 'count4': 693, 'count5': 2398}}
text: There are no lifts at this hotel. Stair climbing is required as the restaurant is up a level up from the ground. The food was very good with a variety of Sri Lankan and western options. The restaurant gets very busy and noisy. The staff were continually busy refilling the buffet offerings which meant it was hotter than at many buffets. Each meal had something being cooked fresh ‚Äì BBQ at dinner, omelette and bacon at breakfast, noodles at lunch. The room was small. We had a sea view, but many of the rooms overlook the pool and would be noisy. The air conditioning is centrally controlled and too hot for us overnight. There were no hand towels in the bathroom. When we asked for them, we were given face washers. The grounds are very nice and well maintained. The sea was too rough for swimming and the pool full of children (it was a weekend when we arrived). We were on an all-inclusive package and had to wear a wrist band but still had to give our room number and sign for drinks!
title: Big Resort

placeInfo: {'id': '316671', 'name': 'Mermaid Hotel & Club', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 3296, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.617478, 'longitude': 79.94547, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d316671-Reviews-Mermaid_Hotel_Club-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.mermaidhotelnclub.com/', 'address': 'Mahawaskaduwawa, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Mahawaskaduwawa', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 30, 'count2': 41, 'count3': 134, 'count4': 693, 'count5': 2398}}
roomTip: Locals please avoid day-outs
text:
Since our first impression itself of the hotel wasn't that good, I will mention the bad stuff first.

Bad:
1.The reception was incredibly rude and mean to us. I don't know if it was because we were locals, but here‚Äôs my warning if you are planning to go for a day out: they didn‚Äôt have any changing rooms. Not even a common changing area. I asked where my sister and I could change after getting into the pool, and the two ladies at the reception pointed us to the bathroom at the entrance. It didn‚Äôt even have a shower‚Äîjust toilets. They didn‚Äôt seem to care at all. The look on the senior receptionist‚Äôs face (if I‚Äôm not mistaken, her name was Thanuja) was sarcastic, and she had such an attitude. 

It cost us Rs. 6,500 per person, but it wasn‚Äôt worth the money. I checked Booking.com too, and there are many bad reviews about the reception. We had an argument as soon as we entered, and it ruined the entire mood. There weren‚Äôt even lockers or a safe place to keep our bags. They said we could leave them on the sofa in front of the reception. I think they need to understand that women can‚Äôt remove their clothes outside or change in a tiny bathroom that only has toilets. And it‚Äôs located in front of the hotel, so we had to walk all the way back to the reception to change.

2. The hotel doesn't look that good as it is shown in the photos.

Good:
1. The staff that was there in the play area (separated from a wall) was so kind to us. They only let us use the bathroom of the spa area to change. That was extremely kind. 
2. They had a lot of games to play like volleyball, badminton, table tennis, a gym, and water polo.
title: Disappointing Experience: Rude Reception and bad first impression
