Cool place
Friendly staff
Superb service

Nice place to hangout friendly front office staff Thanuja Amashi Diluni Nirmana.clean spacious room nice sea and we had good time at garden area kids were very happy that they can play every where delicious food and great service from restaurant specially FNB manager he was so attentive to his guests needs.

We were really happy about our stay and hoping to visit again special thanks to Thanuja for arrange our reservation so smoothly
title: Nice view calm place to hangout

text:
I recently stayed at the Mermaid Hotel in Kalutara and had a fantastic experience, particularly with the front office service. Thanuja, who handled our reservation, was exceptional. Despite our last-minute booking, Thanuda managed to secure us a stunning Deluxe room with a breathtaking sea view. Her efficiency and courteous manner made the process smooth and stress-free.

The Deluxe room itself was nothing short of spectacular. The view of the beautiful sea from our room was simply mesmerizing, providing a serene and picturesque backdrop to our stay. The room was spacious, elegantly decorated, and impeccably clean, ensuring a comfortable and relaxing retreat.
title: Exceptional Service and Stunning Views at Mermaid Hotel Kalutara

roomTip:
Use the pool near the front desk which is less crowded
Can get free unlimited drinks from 7pm - 9pm at the pool side bar
text:
Friendly staff, great service, spacious rooms with beautiful sea views, and authentic meals.
From the check-in to check-out the staff was ready to help with any request and were more than willing to make the trip more memorable to the guests. Mr. Thushara from the front desk welcomed us and showed us around the hotel initially and assisted us readily with everything whenever we called the front desk. He and his team were the cherry on the top of this memorable trip.
Rooms had picturesque sea view and very clean. Both swimming pools were clean and safe (Tip: the pool near the front desk was less crowded)
Pub was great, the barman made great cocktails! Gym had all the basic equipment and a superb trainer, Mr Darmadasa.
Special thanks to Manager Mr. Thushara, team and all the staff members for going above and beyond and making our trip unforgettable!
title: Exceptional Stay with Excellent Service at Turyaa Kaluthara

roomTip: Dont think this hotel is worthy to stay... think twice before booking..
text:
We recently stayed at this hotel, expecting a relaxing and enjoyable experience, but it turned out to be quite the opposite. The hotel was fully booked and overcrowded, making it difficult to enjoy any of the services.
We were excited for the buffet dinner, but it was the worst buffet I have ever had at a 4-star hotel. There was only one meat option (chicken) with no variety at all. The breakfast and lunch the next day were no better, with the fewest choices I‚Äôve ever seen.
On top of that, there were no towels in the room when we arrived. Despite several calls to the front desk, we had to wait a long time to get them. We also asked for an extra water bottle, but were told to refill the one we had ‚Äì something I've never heard from a hotel before.
The worst part was when a room service supervisor entered our room without knocking, even though we hadn‚Äôt checked out yet. It was 12:20 p.m., and my wife was still getting ready. We hadn't handed over our key cards or officially checked out, so this was completely unacceptable.
Overall, this experience was far below what we expected from a 4-star hotel. We won‚Äôt be coming back and  I would not recommend this 
hotel any one.
title: Disappointing Experience at a Supposed 4-Star Hotel

text:
THIS IS SURESH SAMUEL AND FAMILY,

IT WAS OUR FIRST VISIT TO TURYAA KALUTARA AS WE WANTED TO SPEND THE WEEKEND AS A FAMILY AND BOOKED 2 ROOMS. 

I WOULD LIKE TO MENTION THAT STARTING FROM ARRIVAL TO DEPARTURE THE FRONT OFFICE STAFF SPECIALLY RECEPTIONIST MR. SURANGA DID GIVE THEIR BEST TO US TAKING CARE OF ALL THE LITTLE THINGS IN DETAILS.

FROM HERE WE COME TO THE HOUSE KEEPING WHICH WAS EXCELLENT AND THE SEA VIEW  ROOMS 609 AND 610 WAS SPECTACULAR.

FOOD WAS EXCELLENT WITH CHEF  SHANE AND HIS  TEAM WHO WERE ALL VERY FRIENDLY CATERING TO ALL THE TASTE BUDS OF EACH AND EVERY GUST. 

AS THE HOTEL IS ONLY ONE HOUR AWAY FROM COLOMBO WE HAVE DECIDED TO VISIT THIS PROPERTY WHEN EVER WE WANT TO TAKE BREAK FROM OUR BUSY SCHEDULE

WE WOULD RECOMMEND HOTEL TURYAA KALUTARA FOR ANYONE WHO WOULD LIKE TO HAVE A GOOD HOLIDAY. 

WE THANK ALL THE STAFF FOR MAKING OUR STAY A PLEASANT ONE.   
IT IS OUR DUTY ALSO TO THANK MS. AYESHA HULUGALLE, WHO RECOMMENDED THIS PROPERTY TO US.

SURESH SAMUEL AND FAMILY
title: Best Hotel in Town - Kalutara

text:
I have not had bad experiences at Aitken Spence Hotels.This is the fourth hotel I had visited in this chain.

Turyaa provides great value for money.
Friendly service. They even provided me the room service even at midnight due to an emergency.

There was a good spread in the buffet.
Food was delicious.

The room we stayed had a sea view which was so nice. There were two swimming pools and all other amenities that a hotel should have.

We enjoyed our stay very much.
title: Great Value for money

text: I selected Turyaa as it's an Aitken Spence hotel to take my daughter who was on holiday from Australia. I booked two rooms. The room are quite old and there were many malfunctioning features. The phone near the bed was not ringing. A technician came on request, but couldn't fix it. The door lock to the balcony was broken. The air conditioner control wasn't working properly. Staff was helpful, but many issues were beyond their control. The beach adjacent to the hotel was full of dirt including hospital waste washed out from the sea. Walking in the beach was very unpleasant. We were hoping to have a sea bath, but this are is too deep and rough for a safe swim we were told. Food (buffet) was average. I expected a better choice in a hotel like this. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.
title: Disappointed ‚òπÔ∏è Expected a better hotel when I booked an Aitken Spence hotel full board for this price.

text:
Well here we are back again our third trip and a week in all is just as wonderful as ever,treated like long lost family from the moment we arrived,nothing is too much trouble.
My wife is a wheelchair user and everyone pushes her all over the hotel I never get a look in.
The rooms are spotless the food is amazing and if you can't find anything you fancy just ask chef Shane who is a wizard,and he will get you a little something made to order.
How anyone can say there is a lack of choice I cannot understand and the food is wonderful the service impeccable the staff very friendly.
Reviews of this hotel that say things are lacking in areas have some sort of issue I will never fathom.
If you choose this hotel you cannot go wrong,highly recommended.
title: Our special place

roomTip: Before you go, Ask about buffet food spread and food varieties
text:
23 July 2024 - 24 July 2024

Good things

1. Location was beautiful.

2. We loved the indoor playground.

3. It had 2 swimming pools, and one of them was excellent.

4. Room view was wonderful.

5. Some room facilities were excellent.

6. The lighting system was excellent.

7. The air conditioning system was excellent

Bad Things

1. The hotel was old-style, specifically floor tiles. Rooms should be modified.

2. The dinner buffet had very, very limited items. The dinner buffet had some low-quality fruits.

3. The staff was not friendly.

4. If you pay 47,250 for a triple full board, it is actually not worth it. It is not worth more than 30,000.

5. The hot water system was not working sometimes.

6. There are no bathtubs.

7.Sometimes we had to call twice for fulfill our requirements
title: Average

text:
They had the best hospitality ever. Perfect place for a family vacation. Me my husband and two kids enjoyed alot. They have multiple gaming options. We played TT and carom it was so good.
More over, we had to check out late because my son had to sit for an exam. Which they allowed and it was such a relief. I had to attend to lectures in Colombo in the morning and we requested for a early breakfast and again they allowed. With all the tight Timelines we didn't feel a preasure. We really enjoyed the stay simply because of hotels hospitality.
We would go again and recommend to anyone
title: Best hotel experience

ownerResponse:
{'id': '974753341', 'text': "Thank you for the lengthy review of your recent stay at Tangerine. While we are happy to note some of our services and facilities were up to your expectations, we apologize we couldn't meet up to your expectations in certain other areas. 

However we wish to clarify following points.

History of the Hotel 
Yes Tangerine beach hotel hotel opened in year 1983 and we celebrated our 40th Anniversary in year 2023.  Contrary to the information you have found on Google we constantly upgrade our hotel since year 2009. As you have mentioned in the review   2 of our blocks were closed and 55 rooms are under renovation during  the time you stayed with us. We regularly upgrade our services and facilities and Tour Operators around the world audit our property prior to making business contracts with us. Furthermore we are certified with ISO22000:2018 Food hygiene Management and ISO140001:2015 Environmental management system.  We kindly request you to forward the link you have found with outdated information on our renovation in order to rectify the same. 

Prices of Cocktails 
All our menu prices on par with Market rates and we do offer a discount for all our resident guests. Prices of cocktails may vary from LKR 1500 ( AUD 8) to LKR 10,000 ( AUD 50 ) depending on the incidents and the type of liquor used. 

Ordering of Bucket of Ice
Kindly note ordering ice through room service in order to consume your own alcoholic beverages would incur a service charge.

Settlement of the Bills
We sincerely apologize for the incident. The management has taken necessary steps to avoid repetition such incidents. 

While thanking you again for the lengthy review and patronizing Tangerine , we look forward to welcome you in the near future. 

", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-10-21', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}
placeInfo: {'id': '315692', 'name': 'Tangerine Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2208, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.608164, 'longitude': 79.94891, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d315692-Reviews-Tangerine_Beach_Hotel-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.tangerinehotels.com/tangerinebeachhotel/', 'address': 'De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'De Abrew Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 63, 'count2': 78, 'count3': 233, 'count4': 638, 'count5': 1196}}
roomTip: Unless you need to stay in this area, don't bother.
text:
One of the tour hotels for Luxury Tours.  I would not recommend this hotel for future trips.  Hotel looks amazing on first entry, lovely lobby, very grand.  It was raining heavily when we arrived and checkin was okay (group of 16). The first main issue is that the hotel is not conveniently located in my opinion (our tour skipped Galle and staying 1.5 hours away in Kalutura).  I expect the price was a factor in that decision for our tour.

Anyhow, once you get to the rooms and start to get in and look closely, you can see the age of the hotel and the musty smell in many areas, obviously more because of rain that night.  We ended up googling and found the hotel was built in 1983 and apparently last renovated in 1999 (before the tsunami that actually when though hotel). I expect there was some repairs at that point in 2004 also, but otherwise it's really overdue for a refresh.  They had to entire wings of this large hotel shut off and not sure they were planning on reopening, didn't look like any work was going on.  Felt quite creepy in some areas when we walked around.  The spa was badly signposted, feels like it may have moved locations, the jacuzzi for the spa clearly wasn't being used as looks abandoned. There were villas and a beach access door on one side of property that were all shut up or locked, the hotel next door appears to have closed down.  Very gloomy and depressing, so don't recommend exploring.

Rooms were okay size, bathrooms small and kinda gross, mold in the shower cubicle and screens not that nice. Well appointed amenities though, toothbrush and vanity kit etc. Door to bathroom had a glass window with a blind that had seen better days.

When the sun was out the next day, was much nice one the wet smell had mostly gone.  Pool area was nice.  Great that it's next to beach expect you can't swim in it as apparently too rough and heaps drown there, no beach to walk along, so that sucks, just rocks. So basically trapped in the complex. Prices were insane for a Sri Lankan hotel for drinks! Cocktails were Australian prices, so didn't bother trying any. Buffet was okay, extensive food options, but not actually that good and mostly cold. I got excited for crab, but then they deepfried it and provided nothing to help get the crab out of the legs that were coated in batter, very strange.  Almost too much staff, clearing plates away before you really had a chance to finish, and often getting in the way lol.  

Oh and the really annoying thing, I called to ask for some ice.  They bought to the room, and then asked me to sign the BILL!!! For ice.  It was only 240 rupees, but never in my life have I been charged for ice in a hotel. And then the day before we checked out, they rang at 12pm to ask to come and clear the bill since we were leaving next day, and my friend said we will come later. Then they called again at 230pm to ask when we were coming.  I said really, can't we just pay when we check out like normal, and they said we really prefer you to pay before.  (But what if I wanted drinks on the last day). SO anyhow, went down on way to dinner (outside) and cashier wasn't even there, so just an overall complete pain.  They also called everyone else in the tour group to settle their bill before.  Totally unheard of and I have stayed in plenty of hotels over the years. 

We ate next door at the green bamboo the next evening and it was so much better and prices normal.  Highly recommend leaving the hotel to get good prices and yummy food!
title: They will charge you for ice and then annoy you for payment

text: It was booked through Luxury Escapes and this was not luxury. It‚Äôs a dated hotel and needs renovation. The pool area was ok but the umbrellas were full of holes so needed replacing. However the pool bar staff need to have a more welcoming attitude; we‚Äôre Aussie and enjoy a pool bar!! Only if the staff are engaging- these weren‚Äôt.

text:
Our 2 night stay here was very accommodating. Our room was comfortable and very clean. The staff were amazing and always smiling and helpful. There was a variety of delicious food to choose from buffet breakfast as well as the buffet dinner. 
There is access to the beach but no swimming allowed. The pool area is magnificent, with a bar and play area for the children. I would highly recommend staying here. Thank you to all the staff for making our stay memorable.
title: Highly recommended

ownerResponse:
{'id': '973162608', 'text': 'Thank you for the review of your recent visit and provide constructive comments on certain aspects of our services and facilities. We have taken a serious note on the condition of the pool umbrella and cleanliness concerned highlighted.  Rest assured our team will rectify the matters and while apologizing for any inconvenience caused  we thank you for bringing those issues to our attention. 

Furthermore we need to clarify the following.

Beach Condition - Due to adverse weather conditions we experienced over the last two weeks the sea is not conducive for swimming, However on the south side of the hotel there is  decent stretch of the beach is available for our guests to enjoy.

Prices of  Cocktails. - Our cocktail prices are ranging from LKR 1500 to LKR 10,000. Based on the type of the liquor and other ingredients used prices are fixed and our rates are on par with market rates. Furthermore we offer a discount on beverages for all our resident guests.

Breakfast / Dinner Buffet Average - Our valued guests have rated our food buffets very highly based on our recent reviews. We believe this comment would be based on  personal preferences. 

School Group - We apologize for the inconvenience caused , however we noticed that they used the swimming pool facility under the prevailing guidelines. 

Trust above clarifications would clear some of the issues stated in your feedback. We once again thank you for all the comments and look forward to welcome you again in the near future. ', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-10-09', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}
placeInfo: {'id': '315692', 'name': 'Tangerine Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2208, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.608164, 'longitude': 79.94891, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d315692-Reviews-Tangerine_Beach_Hotel-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.tangerinehotels.com/tangerinebeachhotel/', 'address': 'De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'De Abrew Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 63, 'count2': 78, 'count3': 233, 'count4': 638, 'count5': 1196}}
text:
1. Unable to swim at the beach- big fence, rocks, sandbags. There is no beach really.
2. Whole hotel needs a massive makeover. Stained floors, walls, pool area decking lifting, paving needs a good pressure clean. Half the hotel blocked off, deserted.
3. Found the spa. The walkway to this was completely filthy with dirty pond, rotting leaves, mould covered walk way. Truly disgusting. Needless to say we didn‚Äôt book a treatment.
4. When I asked for a menu at the pool bar, barman virtually threw it at me. 
5. Drinks insanely expensive 4000 for a cocktail?!
6. Isolated location- near ugly city/ town
7. Breakfast/ dinner buffet very average
8. School groups - up to 50  children swimming in the pool after school. They were lovely , but don‚Äôt need this when trying to relax at a 4* establishment. 
Stayed for two nights on tour around SL with ‚ÄòLuxury Escapes‚Äô. They need  to seriously rethink the quality of their accomodations.
This is not a 4*- I would rate it 2 at a maximum.
On the plus side, room was clean, pool clean, lobby area lovely.
In short, avoid at all costs.
title: Dreadful

placeInfo: {'id': '315692', 'name': 'Tangerine Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2208, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.608164, 'longitude': 79.94891, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d315692-Reviews-Tangerine_Beach_Hotel-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.tangerinehotels.com/tangerinebeachhotel/', 'address': 'De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'De Abrew Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 63, 'count2': 78, 'count3': 233, 'count4': 638, 'count5': 1196}}
roomTip: If possible to have a seperate bath {instead of the tub} for locals to use, As we don't   like to use bath tubs always.
text:
THIS SMALL 2 DAY REST FROM 4TH TO 6TH OCTOBER 2024  WAS SUDENLY DECIDED. I CONTACTED THE HOTEL AT THE END OF SEPTEMBER AND THE RESERVATION TEAM WAS SO NICE AND PROMPTLY PROVDIED ALL THE RELEVANT EXACT DETAILS FOR THE RESERVATION AND GOT IT CONFIRMED WITHIN 3 DAYS.

THE CHECK IN  WAS DURING EVENING AND WAS WONDERFUL. FROM THE RECEPTION  TO THE ROOM WAS SO SMOOTH AND HAZZLE FREE. THERE WAS NO NEED TO ASK A SINGLE QUESTION ABOUT OUR STAY OVER. ALL THE DETAILS WERE PROVIED KINDLY AND NICELY.

THE ROOM WAS SO WONDERFUL AND ALL THE NECESSARY AND ESSENTIALS WERE PROVIDED. WE WERE 3 AND THE TRIPLE ROOM WAS SO SPACIOUS AND VERY COMFORTABLE AND COSY. IT WAS IN THE UPPER FLOOR  DIRECTLY FACING THE WONERFUL OCEAN WITH A FANTASTIC VIEW.

THE RESATAURANT STAFF WAS VERY FRIENDLY. BUFFET FOOD WAS WONDERFUL. DURING ALL MEAL TIMES, THE BUFFET WAS FULL AND THE  STAFF WAS SO ENERGETIC AND PROVIDED THE  SERVICES  WITH  SMILING FACES.

ALTHOUGH A BIT OLD, THE ARCHITECTURE OF THE HOTEL WAS MARVELLOUS. EVERYWHERE YOU GO, THERE WAS SOMTHING NEW TO SEE. GARDEN KEPT VERY CLEAN.

POOL WAS SO SPACIOUS AND WAS WITHIN THE APPROVED DEPTHS. KEPT VERY CLEN. POOL/BAR  STAFF WAS VERY FRIENDLY AND HELPFUL.

SPA WAS  MAINTAINED METHODICALLY.  NO WAITING HOURS WERE THERE. PROMPLY ATTENDED TO OUR SERVICES. 

OVER ALL THIS HOTEL WAS MAINTAINE VERY WELL. I LIKE TO RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL AS ONE OF THE BEST AT PRESENT. { AS A FAMILY WE TRAVEL A LOT}.

THE AMAOUNT WE PAID WAS FULLY WORTH.  THERE ARE SOME DISCOUNTS THESE DAYS. WE GOT A DISCOUNTED RATE.
title: LEISURE TIME AT KALUTARA

roomTip:
Beach area has been changed lot now, its deep not a very safe for small kids

pool is a deep one but separate child pool is also available
text:
A nice hotel near by Kaluthara town. Food was tasty and enjoyed lot. Spacious rooms and well maintained garden for relaxation. There is a separate kids play area and also separate kids pool as the main pool is very deep.

The beach has been damaged by costal erosion. if you are going to feel the beach and do activates on beach this is not the best place for it. They had some plan to rebuild it, may be it would be better after that. Had few uncomfortable experiences with the service as I think they are less experienced new staff. but overall experience was good.
title: Worth for money

text: We recently stayed at this hotel with a group of about 30 colleagues from Xeptagon for a company outing, and we had a great experience. Tangerine remains one of Sri Lanka's best kept secrets. The beautiful  architecture 
of the  building has the ocean as a background. The food is excellent and we even had the afternoon tea which was elegantly served on silver tiered platters. The place is child friendly and the service is great, with helpful and friendly staff,  starting with the security guard. With less than a 1.5 hour drive from Colombo, this is the perfect holiday getaway for anyone.

placeInfo: {'id': '3596388', 'name': 'Avani Kalutara Resort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 3331, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.568177, 'longitude': 79.96049, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d3596388-Reviews-Avani_Kalutara_Resort-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.avanihotels.com/kalutara/', 'address': "St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka", 'addressObj': {'street1': "St. Sebastian's Road", 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 60, 'count2': 107, 'count3': 260, 'count4': 770, 'count5': 2134}}
text:
I visited the hotel on the long weekend (4 days) & had a night stay.  Main concern - dinner & breakfast buffet was very thin, there were no many variations & the dishes didn't complement.

However the staff was friendly, it was obvious that they were doing their best to serve the full house crowd. Nevertheless, they couldn't manage it at their best. The restaurant didn't house the full house crowd at once. Many including us had to wait for a place to be vacant to sit.

The room we had was Lagoon view, room was clean, by the looks of it, the hotel seemed bit old. For the price (I booked via Booking.com for 41K LKR), some other hotels near the colombo city have so many amenities than Avani. Disappointed in that.
The pool & the beach was very nice.

You may have to bring some sun visors for your vehicle it is burning in the parking lot. Sun will directly shine, if you checkin in early you may be able to reserve a little shaded spot among the few.

Overall, the stay was pleasant! However, you might want to consider some other hotel for this price if you want to enjoy more amenities!
title: Good alternative for a night stay

roomTip: Use the Anantara restaurants next door. The Avani restaurant is poor quality for a resort.
text:
Booked on an app which doesn't show options other than B&B so assumed we could eat a la carte at the restaurant. First night we ate in the room as the kids were tired. Room service menu is unappetitsing and limited. 2nd night was the shocker. Kids were hungry so we went to the restaurant to order from a la carte menu. 10 minutes after sitting and about to order, a server comes to us to say that unless we order a buffet, we can't sit in the restaurant. Further we need to sit by the non-aircondirioned and mosquito overrun lobby area by the BAR (with 2 kids!) and eat a la carte there! We were appalled and walked up to our room to order some rubbish from the awful room service menu. You'd think A RESORT would have better restaurant options and that the hotel's only restaurant would allow 
guests to sit and eat from the restaurant menu! We have traveled all around the world but never seen such nonsense like this. When you sit down at a restaurant to eat, you don't insult guests by asking them to leave the restaurant and eat some place else! When a complaint was made to the manager, he says we can go back in...I said No. You don't insult guests and move them in and out of a restaurant. Who does that?!
title: Hotel restaurant is guest-unfriendly

placeInfo: {'id': '3596388', 'name': 'Avani Kalutara Resort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 3331, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.568177, 'longitude': 79.96049, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d3596388-Reviews-Avani_Kalutara_Resort-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.avanihotels.com/kalutara/', 'address': "St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka", 'addressObj': {'street1': "St. Sebastian's Road", 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 60, 'count2': 107, 'count3': 260, 'count4': 770, 'count5': 2134}}
text:
did not initially intend to write a review, but I feel compelled to share our disappointing experience during our recent stay. We booked a three-night stay on a half-board basis and received a confirmation email stating that the total cost would be approximately LKR 100,000. We paid a 50% deposit in advance.

Before our arrival, the Front Manager contacted us two or three times, and we confirmed that we would be coming for dinner. Upon arrival, however, we were greeted rudely by the security personnel, who disrespectfully spoke to my husband. When we questioned his attitude, he replied, ‚ÄúBecause you are wearing shorts and a t-shirt. I thought you were a driver.‚Äù This was incredibly embarrassing and left us feeling humiliated. We were shocked by such behaviour and disappointed that staff would judge and treat guests based on their attire or presumed occupation.

We were then directed to Anantara Kalutara for dinner, where we were informed that our booking was only for bed and breakfast, not half-board as we had booked and received no prior communication regarding this change. The Front Manager from Avani called us and insisted that we either pay for our dinner or accept sandwiches delivered to our room. This was highly disappointing, especially as we were traveling with our three-year-old son. As a result, we did not enjoy our dinner and returned to our room, which was also quite small and uncomfortable.
They should figure out their internal management issues and should not embarrass their guests based on their mistakes.

Given the circumstances, we decided to transfer to Anantara Kalutara the next morning. The staff at Anantara Kalutara were exceptional, completely transforming our mood and providing a pleasant environment to enjoy the remainder of our vacation in Sri Lanka. I would like to extend my gratitude to Anantara Kalutara for their outstanding service, which made a significant difference in our stay.
title: Bad experience

roomTip: don't waste your money there
text:
Not a 5 star, maybe 4 star!

Had disappointing stay.

Beautiful place but not as beautiful and big as the pictures, clean rooms, very kind housekeepers but the staff were not so friendly and tried not help, specially females! we were 2 ladies and asked for ladies pad but they gave us just 1 pad after 2 days and said they don't have any ladies pad in the hotel! how is that possible? even in every public washrooms there is ladies pad too but in a 5 star hotel.. very disappointing. the location is not closed to any pharmacy or supermarket so we couldn't buy it by ourselves and they didn't help us!

As a 5 star beach resort no seafood on the menu and also no international food. just local food full of spice and we actually didn't eat any food for 4 days!

to everything we ordered, added 30% tax and service charge. what does it mean "service charge" for a 5 star hotel to bring our order just to our table not even to our room?????!!!!!!

also not possible to use the beach because it was very dangerous and there was just 1 man looked at us and didn't seem to rescue us if anything happened! and just 4 unclean plastic sunbeds on the beach, so many dogs slept under them!

many many crows were all over the hotel and stole our foods and very scary but everyone just watched and didn't do anything! when we told the manager he just said we can't do anything, watch out your things!!!!

no entertainment, no music just some entertainment plans that costs a lot plus 30%!!

overall its not worth it to book this hotel. we heard there are many better hotels in the area.
title: not a 5 star, very disappointing

placeInfo: {'id': '3596388', 'name': 'Avani Kalutara Resort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 3331, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.568177, 'longitude': 79.96049, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d3596388-Reviews-Avani_Kalutara_Resort-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.avanihotels.com/kalutara/', 'address': "St. Sebastian's Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka", 'addressObj': {'street1': "St. Sebastian's Road", 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 60, 'count2': 107, 'count3': 260, 'count4': 770, 'count5': 2134}}
text:
My friends and I stayed for one night at Avani Kalutara and loved it. 

The Good:

The hotel is well maintained. The rooms were cozy and comfortable with great amenities. The staff were friendly and helpful. And the food... We ate at the Mangrove restaurant and the food was amazing! We loved the beef stew at dinner, the prawn dish at lunch and the breakfast was plentiful with great options and delicious bread rolls.

The Bad: 

There were two things we feel like the hotel could improve on.

We had to go ourselves to order items to our room as calling the reception and/or the restaurant proved difficult as it was hard to get through to. 

Further, the AC in the bedroom seemed under powered. 

Regardless, we had an amazing stay. Thank you to the staff for periodically checking on us and trying to fix any issues that arose. The check in and check out was quick and hassle free. The staff were friendly and welcoming. The bed was comfortable and perfect for a good night sleep. And as I said before, we LOVED the food. 

We will gladly return.
title: A Lovely Weekend

We went to Royal Palms Beach Hotel last Wednesday with my brother's family for his son's Birth Day. It was yet another refreshing experience at Royal Palms where although I have visited the hotel for at least 10 previous occasions. Starting from the Front Office, Ms. Dilhani assisted in coordinating my visit along with Mr. Amara and Mr. Chandima. I was offered a day room for my day outing as well as it was two families. (Thanks Ms. Dilhani for taking necessary steps in arranging the same) Mr. Chandima and his F&B staff did a splendid and surprising job as they have decorated our table with Birth Day decorations and also there was a small cake cutting event as well which the little one really liked.
Appreciate the kind treatment offered by Mr. Manjula, Mr. Jayatissa and everyone at F&B. Chef. Chaminda who is always with a smile was looking after the food I guess and his services are always there when ever I visited the hotel. House Keeping team and the horticulture team should be applauded for their efforts in keeping the hotel nice and clean at all times.
I will not talk about the beautiful surroundings, glamour and amenities that Royal Palms offers as everyone can witness it via their site.
Finally, I wish to thank Mr. Ravi Kurukulasooriya, the GM of this great hotel for keeping this hotel in the right shape which will help them to serve many more local and foreign guests in the future.
All the Best Royal Palms!
title: Refreshing Experience at Royal Palms

placeInfo: {'id': '315693', 'name': 'Royal Palms Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2652, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.610031, 'longitude': 79.948364, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d315693-Reviews-Royal_Palms_Beach_Hotel-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://royalpalms.tangerinehotels.com', 'address': 'De Abrew Road, Kalutara Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'De Abrew Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': None}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 60, 'count2': 63, 'count3': 146, 'count4': 592, 'count5': 1791}}
text:
My wife and I traveled to the Royal Palms on the 8 October for 2 weeks. Has soon as we walked into reception we were looked after, and things never changed for the fortnight we where there.
Every single member of staff had a smile on there faces and would always ask if everything was OK .
Our ground floor room(137) was spacious and clean with a great view of the pool and sea. The buffet restaurant gave a good option of breakfast, lunch and evening meals.
The pool attendants (priyantha and another guy sorry forgot his name) would always bring your towels to your sunbeds and make sure you had the same beds everyday. The drinks in the bars was plenty full and lots of choices, it was a shame you could only have 1 glass of wine with your meal. It would be good if there was an alternative to the entertainment that they put on in the lobby bar but that's me being petty.
There is no beach directly to the hotel due to the high tides but you can excess it from either end of the resort but you will have to step over a lot of rocks, unfortunately the sea is very rough and to dangerous to go into. You will get a lot of the locals wanting you to go in there shops or on their tuk tuks but with a friendly no they leave you alone or just want to talk to you.
We took the local train to Galle which was a great experience sitting with the locals but very hot and a lot cheaper than getting a taxi or booking through the rep.
We had a lovely meal in the Japanese restaurant on our last night and fully looked after by Nawod.
I would highly recommend the hotel and we will definitely return.
title: Great hotel, we will return

placeInfo: {'id': '315693', 'name': 'Royal Palms Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2652, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.610031, 'longitude': 79.948364, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d315693-Reviews-Royal_Palms_Beach_Hotel-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://royalpalms.tangerinehotels.com', 'address': 'De Abrew Road, Kalutara Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'De Abrew Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': None}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 60, 'count2': 63, 'count3': 146, 'count4': 592, 'count5': 1791}}
roomTip: Scammers outside hotel, not a beach hotel
text:
The hotel and the people who work here do anything they can to make your stay memorable from the dining room, front desk, cleaners, pool attendants and Animation staff.
Our room was big and comfortable everything you could ask for.
The only downside there‚Äôs a railway line at one side of the hotel and where there used to be a beach at the other before the Tsunami, you have to be on your guard if you venture out into town, scammers will try you at every turn.
We went on a tour of hill country and south west Sri Lanka probably more in the way of tourist areas, we arranged holiday and tour through Mercury Holidays, the tour was with your own driver and guide who was very good and informative, it was a 2 night 3 day tour not cheap and we were not pleased when they put us up in a poor hotel on first night, but they up for it with rest of tour 1st class all the way.
We were all inclusive the first week one glass of wine with lunch and dinner and local spirits and beer, drink wise not the best for all inclusive, my partner only drinks wine so she got 2 glasses of wine with lunch and dinner but had to sign to declare she wouldn‚Äôt drink any other alcohol. 
Second week we were half board we paid locally better option.
title: First visit to Sri Lanka

text:
We have just returned from six nights at the hotel. We stayed at a number of hotels while visiting Sri Lanka and have no hesitation in saying that this was the best, even though the others were all pretty good.
The rooms are large and airy with effective air conditioning. The beds are comfortable with excellent pillows. 
The food is of a very high standard with a large amount of variety. We spent a lot of time in or around the pool which is large and inviting.
The staff are all extremely pleasant and keen to make your stay a happy one. This was exemplified by Chanaka who cleaned our room and made the elephant and monkey towel-sculptures.
We found this hotel ideal since it was close to a small collection of shops, cafes and restaurants.
title: Ideal situation and lovely people.

placeInfo: {'id': '315693', 'name': 'Royal Palms Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2652, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.610031, 'longitude': 79.948364, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d315693-Reviews-Royal_Palms_Beach_Hotel-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://royalpalms.tangerinehotels.com', 'address': 'De Abrew Road, Kalutara Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'De Abrew Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': None}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 60, 'count2': 63, 'count3': 146, 'count4': 592, 'count5': 1791}}
text:
I don‚Äôt normally write reviews but feel this hotel needs to be spoken about.
The hotel is excellent I would rate it as a 4.5 star. 
The pool staff  are amazing give them a small tip on day one and they will reserve your sun beds for the duration of your stay, although there were always beds available.
Staff are amazing, it‚Äôs not save to swim in the sea but the pool makes up for that as you can walk in to it and most of the pool is only a mtr deep so perfect for small ones, it‚Äôs also immaculate and warm.
Room attendant Subasingh was amazing with different towel animals on our bed everyday.
Pool bar staff ( Dines) again excellent.
The spa needs upgrading but staff were very nice and treatments are in exspensive.

Negative points.

Drinks are poor quality.
The train line next to hotel is bad we thought we would ignore it but at 04.00 hrs they start and it sound like there in your room.
title: Excellent hotel very relaxing holiday.

placeInfo: {'id': '315693', 'name': 'Royal Palms Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2652, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.610031, 'longitude': 79.948364, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d315693-Reviews-Royal_Palms_Beach_Hotel-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://royalpalms.tangerinehotels.com', 'address': 'De Abrew Road, Kalutara Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'De Abrew Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': None}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 60, 'count2': 63, 'count3': 146, 'count4': 592, 'count5': 1791}}
roomTip: Room 221 and surrounding rooms have a lovely view over the pool to the beach with great sunsets.
text: We added the Royal Palms to the end of a 12 day tour of Sri Lanka for a little r&r. Prior to arrival I requested  a room near the one we had before and we were allocated the same room. On arrival we were met by Dilhani (a credit to the hotel as is Mr Chaminda). We were offered a refreshing drink and taken straight to our room to be supprised by a lovely welcome back. All the staff we met were excellent, always there with a greeting and a smile. A special mention to Ajesh on reception, Priyantha  our pool attendant and Ajith  who kept our room spotless. There is a good selection of food in the restaurant both local and international. The local Lion Beer and spirits are good with plenty of choices of cocktails on the AI, my favourite was the Arrack cocktail. Unfortunately the beach isn't brilliant as most of it has been washed away and while we were there the red flag was out and the waves were high however the pool is lovely. There are activities, a gym, spa and shops around the area with plenty of Tuk tuks available
title: A return visit to this lovely hotel

text:
We were very satisfied with the hotel. The staff here is very friendly and help with any problem. We were particularly impressed by DINESH (pool bar) and the animator PAVINDU (volleyball).

We loved to join the animationprogram and the hotelarea is very clean. We travel in september, there waves in the sea were about 1 meter high, so we could not go diving or go snorceling. Pay attention to the saison when you are planing your Trip.

placeInfo: {'id': '315693', 'name': 'Royal Palms Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2652, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.610031, 'longitude': 79.948364, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d315693-Reviews-Royal_Palms_Beach_Hotel-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://royalpalms.tangerinehotels.com', 'address': 'De Abrew Road, Kalutara Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'De Abrew Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': None}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 60, 'count2': 63, 'count3': 146, 'count4': 592, 'count5': 1791}}
text:
We were on holiday at this hotel for two weeks in July
Despite the low occupancy, the food was great and very tasty. We were taken care of very touchingly. If something wasn't in stock, you didn't have to queue and wait, it was brought to our table afterwards. There was everything from everyone. 
When we looked at the pool from our balcony in the morning, our loungers were covered with towels and when it rained, which happened often, the wet towels were replaced immediately.
Also big compliments to the guys from the pool bar. Dinesh and Sanath in particular sweetened our sometimes rainy days with delicious drinks.
You just have to get used to the fact that you have to sign for all drinks, even as an all-inclusive guest. 
The animation is also minimal and subtle. Fantastic. 
The room cleaning was good.	
The manager regularly inquired about our satisfaction
In the same way, the doors were always held open for you so that you didn't make any effort. The hotel is recommended because of the very friendly staff
title: A lovely holiday with great people

Front desk: Kasun and Hamsa
Door: Duminda (the biggest smile ever)
Restaurant: Rusiru 
Bars: Dinesh 
Thank you so much Royal Palms but especially the above 5 who made us smile......alot
Karen & Roy Blackburn
title: Brilliant staff

roomTip: From arrival to departure you'll be glad you made this choice..
text:
Without doubt the best hotel holiday experience we've ever had. On our honeymoon was hoping for something special and royal palms beach is certainly that.
From the moment you arrive to the minute you leave the exceptional staff just can't do enough for you.  
Super efficient, warm, patient and always full of smiles and kindness. 
Abiding memories of hotel are wonderful facilities but overwhelmingly it is the staff who make this such a magical place. 
Special mentions to Upali, Nawod, Benura, Duminda, Jayindu, Chanaya, Jayasena.  Kasun was welcoming and helpful every day in reception and is a lovely man. Special thanks to the chefs for delicious food every day, and also for our exquisite Japanese meal on our last night.
We have recommended this exceptional hotel, and your beautiful country, to everyone we know.  
No wonder it receives so many awards.  We'd give it our own if we could..
title: Best Hotel with the Best Sri Lanka people.

text:
We visited the Royal Palms Beach Hotel, Kalutara on 31st August 2024, and must say it was a very pleasant and memorable stay. The front office Manager was extremely polite and friendly and we were welcomed with a delicious refreshing drink of Pineapple and Nelli juice.  We met the General Manager for the first time, on arrival and he was extremely welcoming and friendly. 

All three meals were sumptuous buffets and the choice of meals very well planned. Our thanks to the Chef and Sous Chefs who displayed their culinary skills very effectively.

The best experience was having wonderful, happy and courteous staff attending to us at all times, and they were very well trained to look after the guests requirements. We believe this is only possible when you have an excellent General Manager at the helm!!

Our room was located in a very convenient place with a beautiful view, and was spotlessly clean. Thank you .

We enjoyed our stay immensely and will be back soon!

Melanie Jayasinghe 
( Retired) Senior Manager 
Srilankan Catering Services Limited.
title: Our experience at the Royal Palms Beach Hotel, Kalutara.

text:
REVIEW ON VISIT TO ROYAL PALM BEACH HOTEL WASKADUWA SRI LANKA

We Visited the Royal Palm Beach Hotel and stayed there for two days from 31 Aug 2024 to 01 Sept 2024.
We were welcomed by the charming, Front Office Supervisor Ms Dilhani, who attended quickly and competently to our checking in. Dilhani with her charming smile, extremely helpful attitude and courtesy created an excellent first impression. Our room was spacious with a balcony overlooking the unusual and enchanting pool surrounded by the dark sandstone hued hotel buildings which are beautifully designed. 
	The breakfast, Lunch and Dinner buffets were good and the food was tasty. It speaks volumes for the expertise of the Chef and Souse Chef and experience of their staff.
	The spontaneous reaction and special treatment; given by the General Manager and Staff; including a lovely birthday cake, special table and room decor etc; when they came to know it was my Birthday; were simply amazing and also very touching. 
	We experienced something very distinctive in this hotel which we have not observed in many other hotels in Sri Lanka (we have visited many similar grade hotels over many decades with family and friends); and that was, that every member of the Staff was always courteous, friendly and with a ready smile. They treated both Foreigners and Locals the same (which is sadly rarely found in many hotels locally). They were always active, alert and looked happy. The stewards were well trained and very efficient and courteous. They were committed to their jobs and looked content at work and also understood customer service very well. Those are unique and rare features for hotel employees in Sri Lanka today, and reflect good management very clearly. 
	The General Manager Mr Ravi Kurukulasuriya whom we met for the first time was simply amazing. During our short stay we noticed his presence for short spells everywhere be it the lobby, lounge or dining area. We noticed him moving very quickly and energetically all the time which no doubt was his custom, speaking courteously with guests and checking on food in the buffet area, speaking with staff members and always personally involved with the activities going on in the hotel. He was easily and quickly contactable at any time. In my opinion his presence was felt and his imprint evident throughout the Hotel. We also noticed the presence of the tall F & B Asst Mgr Niroshan who never failed to inquire about the food and well-being from us and other guests whilst attending to matters in the Restaurant during meal times. Similarly the Managers in the Reception area made their presence felt by interacting with and attending to the guests.
	The traditional music played by a local group in the restaurant provided a pleasant background at lunch time. The features of a band playing on Saturday and a one man band playing on Sunday in the Lounge throughout the evenings were extraordinarily enjoyable.
	All-in all it was a relaxing, marvelous and memorable week end for us. We wish to thank the General Manager and all his Staff for their kind, caring, attentive and unforgettable hospitality. A big thank you to all of them. We will certainly be back.
With best wishes

Maj Gen Anton Wijendra (Retd) RWP RSP VSV USP MSc ndc psc and
Mrs Suranganie Wijendra BA
title: A MARVELOUS WEEK END

roomTip: The sea front rooms have a beautiful view to the sea and spectacular view of the sunset in the evening and walking distances to the pool.
text:
On 31st of August 2024, we went as a group trip organized by Hatton National Bank CTP Sports Club. This is my visit to the hotel after Covid Pandemic in 2020. The hotel has been refurbished and real five star standards are value addition to the hotel. The rooms are perfectly and tastefully designed according to the sea ambience and luxury. Calm and quiet rooms with only the sea waves melody to the ears at night. Comfortable beds with beautiful wooden furniture complemented with Mini bar, Cable Tv, Tea Coffee making facility and a spacious wardrobe. The bathroom is spacious and with a rain shower.

All three meals are buffet and with wide spread of sea food, meat items and local Sri Lankan delicacies. I have been to so many hotels in Sri Lanka and major developed economies worldwide, however the taste of the food in the hotel is beyond words can describe. Simply amazing. At the time of check in to check out the staff courtesy and smiling faces helpful to keep up the spirit high of our trip. Special complements to the restaurant staff for their efficient and courtesy service with smiling faces and served beyond expectations. Truly I can give a five star rating for accommodation, service and cleanliness. Simply amazing.
title: Five star Luxury in the shores of the Indian Ocean with splendid vacation.

roomTip:
Wonderful atmoshere, great staff, delisious food. 
Lack of real beach during monsoon season.
text:
This was amazing vacation. Weather was great (even if it was monsoon season). 
Staff in the hotel is excelent: Dinesh in the pool bar, "multilanguage" Sanjeewa in the restaurant, cleaning guy, Kasun at the reception, Crishma and Pavinda. I would say that they are best of the best and deserve some rewards!

Food was great and delicious. 
The only concern was snacks. It could be a bit more selection. We were missing fruits there. It could be improved. Especially that Sri Lanka is famous for its fruits)

Summarizing, we are happy we could spend 2 weeks in the hotel, sightseeing Sri Lanka, having great food, enjoying swimming pool, sunbathing and beeing surrounded by atmoshere created by people having real fun to serve to the guests. 

Many thanks!
title: Great vaction, excelent staff

text:
There is a lovely, laid back atmosphere to this hotel and the moment you enter the reception area there is a wonderful ambiance. The staff are incredibly friendly, courteous and helpful; particularly the concierge and reception staff; all other staff were also exceptional.

Although the main restaurant is classified as ‚Äòbuffet style‚Äô there were at least three chefs preparing fresh food at all services; breakfast, lunch and dinner. The choice of food was very good and there was always a good selection of local dishes; be extremely wary of the innocuous chicken starter as it was the only dish that nearly beat me in terms of spiciness; I managed in the end. Although desserts were mainly European in style I have to thoroughly recommend the coconut pudding; absolutely delicious. 

There were never any issues with sunbeds and the pool staff would always ensure that you got the sunbed of choice. The freeform pool was lovely and maintained to a high standard. The pool bar was an added bonus!

The standard of the rooms was very good and, although, there were some general small maintenance issues, when reported they were swiftly sorted. During my stay I had a room change as the monsoon rains made my first balcony somewhat precarious. There are monsoons in August and the sight of horizontal rain must be seen. The bed and pillows were one of the best I have ever slept in; they are just so comfortable.

Overall a really relaxing stay and I would like to say a huge thank you and if I were to return to Sri Lanka I would seriously consider returning to this hotel.
title: A wonderful, relaxed, hotel

We celebrated our wedding anniversary with a delightful stay at Royal Palms Hotel. The warm welcome and exceptional hospitality from the staff made us feel right at home.

The food was outstanding, and we thoroughly enjoyed the buffet offerings.

A special thank you to Ms. Dilhani at the front desk and the team who created a magical surprise for our anniversary. Your attention to detail made our stay truly memorable.
title: Absolutely loved the hospitality

text: I‚Äôm not sure where to start for this absolutely incredible experience. My wife and I had the wedding of our dreams at Royal palms beach hotel on 9th Aug 2024. When beginning to look around for venues, from BMICH wedding show, I met shameel from Royal palms accidentally and first impression is very positive then we decided to book the venue same day. Around 7 pm I decided to call, and the minute I spoke with Shameel (who was very quick to respond), I knew we had found our location. To begin with, Shameel is a kind, very helpful man, who genuinely wants to make your event perfect. Shameel was very tactful and kind when explained our situation, and helped us find the perfect options for us. Honestly, absolutely everything provided exceeded our hopes and expectations. The entire process of planning was so easy ‚Äì made seamless by Shameel and Amara, ( F&B Manager) Both of them made every effort to accommodate us in every way to make it the most special day for us. They were always quick to respond, making communication simple. All aspects of the contract were clearly explained, and the timeline / due dates were easy to follow. We held our reception in the stunning, tastefully, as we only had around 150 people. The table settings were gorgeous, the drinks were perfect, and the plated meals and their presentation were outstanding. I love that royal palm‚Äôs wedding packages. we didn‚Äôt have to stress about a thing! Speaking of the packages offered, royal palms has amazing options for any budget! For our ceremony, During the reception, the staff were amazing and kind to everyone, and treated us, literally, like royalty. Our friends and family raved for weeks about how incredible everything was, saying it was the perfect mix of class and unpretentiousness. Even my 18 year old cousin could not believe the quality of everything and has declared he, too, will be married at Royal palms üòÇ I can recommend this venue, and all of it‚Äôs staff. I wish we could host more events there! A million thanks to Shameel, Amara and Dilki ( front office ) for giving us an unbelievable day, and memories we will cherish for a lifetime.
title: Wedding at Royal Palms

text:
I love how the service from hotel is caring about environment, how they reduce the use of plastic (although there were too much plastic bottles), the people there are so nice and helpful, especially at the time were my sister got injured and the receptionist made a quick phone call to get us to the nearest hospital asap, the driver also was riding in such a rush, it was really amazing how quickly they managed to take care of my sister to get her help, it was really lovely from them.
I really love this specific scent you can smell at the hotel, I don't know what was it but whenever I think of it, I want to go back there! The food was top-notch, the activities run by two guys from the gym were so fun and healthy - overall I'd love to visit this place one day again!
title: Royal Palms at royal place! The environment, service, food and activities

text:
We stayed at the Royal Palms for 2 weeks and could not be happier with our experience. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel extremely welcome. The facilities are excellent and our room was big and comfortable with a lovely ocean view. 

The hotel is well maintained from the impressive reception area to the pool area. The reception staff are extremely helpful and nothing is too much trouble. A special mention to Kasun who from our first morning provided excellent hospitality. 

The service in the restaurant and bars is also excellent with very attentive staff who seem to instantly remember you and always give you a warm greeting at every meal time. Nawod Megana and Sanjeewa were especially nice and welcoming, and provided an excellent service.

All pool attendants were very conscientious and made sure you had everything you needed every morning. 

It was my fianc√©s‚Äô  birthday whilst we were staying at the hotel and they went to the trouble of decorating our room and dinner table that evening which was a lovely surprise, even giving us a birthday cake.

We thoroughly enjoyed our time at The Royal Palms. It is one of the best hotels we have stayed in so I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.
title: Beautiful hotel in a wonderful country

roomTip: Book the hotel and judge for yourself, hope you have the same experience as we did. Excellent.
text:
My husband and I have visited this hotel 5 times, the first visit January 2005 just after the tsunami the devastation was  was heart breaking to see, Now just me.
The greeting  you get when arriving at reception is overwhelming as immediately you are recognised. 
All the staff are there to make your holiday a great experience as they say the country is the pearl of the ocean. This goes for the staff as well.
Hotel and service in every department is excellent. Nothing is too much trouble for any of the staff.
Rooms are beautiful and comfortable and with balcony looking over the pool and the ocean.
Newly refurbed dinning room is very comfortable. Also plenty of outside dinning,
The pool is maintained by the wonderful pool boys who look after everyone with great respect always willing to help.
Sadly the beach has been taken over by the sea and not much can be done about this. But the grounds and pool are wonderful.
Made many friends of the years. The sad part is the beach boys and girls can no longer come to the beach to sell there goods. They also are very nice people who would do anything for you and treat you with great respect.
I look forward to returning as soon as possible.
Recommend this hotel
title: My Pearl of the Ocean

text: We arrived at hotel about 11.30am. We were shown to our room. After a long flight and an hour transfer we were exhausted. We were shocked with the room. It was smelly and insects crawling over the units and ants all over the toilet. We just put the Do not disturb sign on door and went to sleep. We were woken up by the Receptionist to tell us the Rep wanted to see us. I told him we were tired and tell the Rep we‚Äôll see him the next day. We got showered and went to have a look round the hotel. We went the restaurant and were greeted by lovely waiters who looked after us. After a lovely meal and drink at the bar, we went back to our room. Next morning we went for breakfast so much choice and again looked after by the lovely waiters. We went back to the room and again the receptionist knocked to say the Rep wanted to see us. I went down on my own to see him. He asked was I happy with the room? I said no it‚Äôs smelly and dirty. He also tried to get us to book trips which were expensive. After a day at the pool. We went back to our room it was spotless!!!. We later found out new owners had took over this hotel and there were a lot of changes going on. It needs a good modernising with new beds, linen and towels.     On the whole we had a lovely 2 weeks at this hotel. The food was very good. The staff couldn‚Äôt do enough for you. They work really hard.                               We met a lovely guy called Cena on the beach who was so helpful. We booked a trip with him and he took us where we wanted to go. He stayed with us and was an excellent guide. We would definitely recommend him.
title: Very dated hotel

placeInfo: {'id': '8356701', 'name': 'Coco Royal Beach Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 499, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.613645, 'longitude': 79.947205, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d8356701-Reviews-Coco_Royal_Beach_Resort-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://cocoroyalbeach.com/', 'address': 'Beach Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Beach Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 21, 'count2': 24, 'count3': 53, 'count4': 174, 'count5': 227}}
roomTip: The sea is too rough for swimming, with a very steep bank down to the waters edge.
text:
We stayed at the Coco Royal Beach Resort for 3 weeks from 14th February,  2024 on an all inclusive basis (wine is NOT all inclusive). Its a basic hotel, with friendly staff and a beachfront location.  The rooms are huge, either ground or first floor with terrace or balcony and located surrounding a large patch of grass with a large, well maintained swimming pool at one end.

The hotel is under new ownership and improvements and changes were being made throughout our stay.

There are no hairdyers in the rooms, but I was able to borrow one from reception for the duration of my holiday.   Rooms are cleaned and towels replaced daily.  Sometimes the sheets, pillowcases  and towels were a bit grubby looking, but we were assured they were clean, they smelt clean.

The hotel laundry service is fast, very good and  reasonably priced.

All rooms have a fridge which we were grateful for as the beer from the bar was not cold enough for us,  there was no problem in us taking unopened beers and mixers to the room to get colder.  I took some ice cube bags with me and made ice in my room too (thank goodness I did, as the ice machine in the bar was regularly out of action).  There are tea and coffee making facilities in each room ( the tea bags provided are lovely).  Bottled water is provided daily and as needed.  The water from the tap is good for making tea and coffee and brushing teeth.  There are a variety of different plug sockets in the room (UK, EU and old style round 3 pin), a universal adapter was provided.

The restaurant was OK with buffet style at breakfast with someone to cook eggs/omelette, a bit more practice is required to get fried eggs cooked to personal liking, but they did try.   Dinner was also buffet style.   The food was good, but could have been hotter at times.  Salads were fresh, soup was always tasty.  The curries and rices were delicious, I particularly liked the daal fry.   The papadums with lime pickle and mango chutney were always good.  

The hotel were trialling a set menu for lunchtime,  whereby  staff members would ask guests individually their meal preferences from a couple of choices for each course.  It prevented waste and was generally good. 

A railway line at the front of the hotel runs parallel to the beach but noise from this is minimal.  You can cross the railway line on foot, just outside the hotel for quicker access to the main road that leads to Colombo in one direction and Galle in the other.  Buses are cheap and frequent and sometimes a white knuckle experience.  There are tuktuks outside the hotel gates that for a negotiated price, will take you wherever you want to go.  

The hotel will provide a breakfast bag on request for those going on trips with early starts. 

We booked our holiday with Tui and felt it was good value.  Their excursions, however,  were over priced.  We booked a 2 night, 3 day excursion locally,  via Buddka at the Green Bamboo bar.  Our excursion was amazing value, just the two of us too, and included far more than the Tui excursion for ¬£55 less per person.  

Finally, a shout out to Kanishka Maduvanga and Ashen Madu at the bar, Akila in the restaurant and Ragu and Bradley on reception.
title: Work in progress

placeInfo: {'id': '8356701', 'name': 'Coco Royal Beach Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 499, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.613645, 'longitude': 79.947205, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d8356701-Reviews-Coco_Royal_Beach_Resort-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://cocoroyalbeach.com/', 'address': 'Beach Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Beach Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 21, 'count2': 24, 'count3': 53, 'count4': 174, 'count5': 227}}
text:
My husband and I have just returned to the UK from a wonderful 3 weeks holiday at the Coco Royal Beach Hotel in Kalutura, Sri Lanka. We were in room 211 from the 19th February till the 11th March 2024.
When we arrived at the hotel 6.30am in the morning, the Manager Mr Randun was waiting to welcome us such a nice man. During our stay he was always asking if all was ok and if there was anything he could do for us. He was waiting to say goodbye and wish us a safe journey home when we were leaving too.
Ragu the receptionist checked us in, such a lovely young man always had a beaming smile and so helpful throughout our stay. So was his supervisor Bradley.
We were shown to our room by the House keeping Manager Kosala yet another polite and helpful young man always asking if there was anything he could do for us.  Our room was large with a balcony overlooking the beach and sea.  All his staff who cleaned our room did an excellent job.
We went to the pool where we met more helpful people the pool attendants Nuwan, Manoj and Chandika who couldn't do enough for us and everyone else.
At dinner and breakfast the restaurant managers Akila and Suchira and their staff was so good. Nothing was any trouble to them all they wanted to do was make us happy and enjoy our meals.
The Barman who rounded off our evenings with the best cocktails ever and the best Aarack cocktail was Kanishka.
All the staff at this hotel are absolutely amazing, very hardworking and wonderful people who always greeted you with a smile and nothing was too much trouble for them.
The hotel has recently been taken over about a week before we arrived and will be renamed shortly. Already upgrades are taking place so any shortfalls will be improved.  We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.
Thank you to all the staff at Coco Royal Beach Hotel for making our stay in Sri Lanka one we will not forget.
title: The staff in this hotel from Management down made our stay perfect. A brilliant holiday.

placeInfo: {'id': '8356701', 'name': 'Coco Royal Beach Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 499, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.613645, 'longitude': 79.947205, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d8356701-Reviews-Coco_Royal_Beach_Resort-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://cocoroyalbeach.com/', 'address': 'Beach Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Beach Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 21, 'count2': 24, 'count3': 53, 'count4': 174, 'count5': 227}}
roomTip: Ask for a room on floor four. Best views of sea and sunset
text:
This is a three star hotel and so set your expectations accordingly and also that three star SL is not like the UK. The one factor that made this hotel stand out was the superb staff. Special mentions to Akila the Bar Captain who is simply amazing. Nothing is too much for him and he truly truly care about his guests. He should be in a more senior position for me and soon. The new GM (sorry no name) is brilliant. Available all the time, very visible and despite having only been there a few weeks he is making huge change and a making great difference. The brand new barman is also a breath of fresh air - bar now clean and drinks in stock and well made. 

Our first few days were a bit like Fawlty Towers with room not cleaned and drinks running out. It did though became clear why as the hotel was sold whilst we were there and the new multi millionaire owner arrived to meet the staff. In the final few days there was noticeable change - a new fence installed by the beach, new lights fitted to the pool and massive painting underway inside and outside the rooms and no drinks shortages at all. 

To be clear we  had some issues at the hotel as we were AI via TUI and there was no snack bar as advertised, drinks sid run out and also no wine on AI. The latter being due to the rising cost of wine rising (as staff told us and other guests) and not due to it never being included as the TUi rep lied to us and others about. 

Food was tasty and the masseuse was also superb with an hour full body for just ¬£13!!!  Always plenty of beach towels and sunbeds and so never a risk to not have somewhere to lie down. Ladies on the beach by the gate are also brilliant and very reasonable for their clothing and also cheap fresh coconuts too. Don‚Äôt ignore them and share some love to them. 

This hotel has the chance to be amazing if the new GM gets supported. It‚Äôs small and so you get such a personal experience from the great staff. If it were mine I‚Äôd have the masseuse services advertised in every room with prices and also I‚Äôd get the snack bar open asap so the non AI guests will eat and drink there assuming you also get a menu with prices on display. 

If we had the final few days for the whole time then this three star hotel would have had a five rating and it was the staff - especially Aklia and the GM that gave them a four and not a three rating.

If you want a personal and authentic boutique hotel on the beach - this is for you.
title: Improving Daily

placeInfo: {'id': '8356701', 'name': 'Coco Royal Beach Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 499, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.613645, 'longitude': 79.947205, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d8356701-Reviews-Coco_Royal_Beach_Resort-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://cocoroyalbeach.com/', 'address': 'Beach Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Beach Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 21, 'count2': 24, 'count3': 53, 'count4': 174, 'count5': 227}}
text:
My parents spent two weeks here in January 2024 and have come back feeling refreshed and energised.  Please take any negative reviews left here with a pinch of salt. 

The staff at this hotel work extremely hard to ensure the guests are fully catered for. 

The quality of food and variety was superb - plenty of seafood choices and freshly caught. Many compliments to the one of the chefs, Nimal, who went above and beyond during our stay.

Another shout out goes  to the management, in particular, the general manager Mr Randan- he, with his team, are working super hard to ensure that guests enjoy their stay in their whole entirety.

The location of this hotel is excellent - and right on the beach. My parents have told me that they will definitely return to this place in the future.
title: Superb hotel, will return again!

placeInfo: {'id': '8356701', 'name': 'Coco Royal Beach Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 499, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.613645, 'longitude': 79.947205, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d8356701-Reviews-Coco_Royal_Beach_Resort-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://cocoroyalbeach.com/', 'address': 'Beach Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Beach Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 21, 'count2': 24, 'count3': 53, 'count4': 174, 'count5': 227}}
roomTip: Don‚Äôt go here
text: 6 of us booked to stay at this hotel for two weeks with Tui, on arrival we were disappointed with the place but decided to give it the benefit and see how things went. The rooms were basic but clean, the food was just about ok but the real problems started with the all inclusive drinks package, on the first night they had no tonic water, second night no coke, then no sprite and then only two bottles of beer, the place was a joke, the only positive thing was Steven the bar man who seemed the only person in the hotel who had any idea what was going on. We contacted the hotel manager who informed us they were having issues with delivery of drinks and to bear with us. We contacted the Tui representative Milan who attempted to fob us off and said he would sort the drinks problem, we had noticed the advertised pool bar was actually a sleeping area for the security guard and had not reopened following COVID, the same with the other advertised facilities, the sun beds were either damaged or split and the place was very run down, eventually the Tui representative agreed to move us to another hotel an hour away, Milan from Tui asked us not to tell anyone else we were getting the move how dishonest and despicable is this for customer care and service. We moved to another hotel that was much better but we will never book another holiday with Tui they knew the state of the Co Co beach and are still sending people there.
title: Terrible
