placeInfo: {'id': '8356701', 'name': 'Coco Royal Beach Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 499, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.613645, 'longitude': 79.947205, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d8356701-Reviews-Coco_Royal_Beach_Resort-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://cocoroyalbeach.com/', 'address': 'Beach Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Beach Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 21, 'count2': 24, 'count3': 53, 'count4': 174, 'count5': 227}}
text:
Its not 4*, it's a poor 3*.
Our room was dirty-smelly curtains, stains on the walls, stains on the linen, dirty mirrors and glass door, dirty baseboards, dust and webs on lamps, sticky surface of furniture (the paint/lacquers fault) , limescale on the bathroom floor, disgusting bin in the bathroom, uncleaned surfaces under the sink and in the shower. Linen changed only once a week. Only bath towels available, nothing more. 
Food: we only had breakfasts. There were 4 types of curry which was very tasty. But basic things for europeans like cheese were missing, also the staff in the Restaurant was poor. Basics like scrambled eggs were out quickly but the staff was just standing there doing nothing instead of bringing more eggs etc. There was no water for self service, waiters were supposed to pour it but most of the times they were chatting with each other instead of doing their jobs. The coffe/tea area was dirty. The coffee was bad. 
The pool area looks very nice, there are a lot of palmtrees, but sunbeds were incredibly old and most of them was broken.
The beach was very nice but local people camping there all day long were discouraging. The were obtrusing, brazen. They kept offering some trips, clothes, they kept standing there leaning on the fence and STARING on the people on the sunbeds. It was totally creepy. Sometimes a man with a monkey on a leash and a snake in a sack was coming there too. Hotel security was doing nothing about it. Also one of the security staff kept a bottle of alcohol under his chair so... 
Most of the stuff was nice and helpful like house keeping guys and Ragu from the reception.
There are people in the hotel trying to make it better after pandemic but it will take time. It should start with a deep cleaning of the rooms and restaurant. Also the reception looks very poor and creates a bad first impression (dirty wall, sticky counter, no decorations, some old and ugly chair). The hotel has a great potential but it needs a lot of work to become a good 4* hotel.
title: Not good

placeInfo: {'id': '10628005', 'name': 'Club Waskaduwa Beach Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 296, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.616225, 'longitude': 79.94573, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d10628005-Reviews-Club_Waskaduwa_Beach_Resort_Spa-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.clubwaskaduwabeachresort.com', 'address': '211 Jayanthi Mawatha (Parallel Road) Waskaduwa North, Waskaduwa, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '211 Jayanthi Mawatha (Parallel Road)', 'street2': 'Waskaduwa North, Waskaduwa', 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 35, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 37, 'count4': 71, 'count5': 132}}
text: The hotel is nice and cozy. The staff is super friendly and accommodating. We had gone for a chess tournament and the matches always ended late. The manager, Mohd Shahmir, made special arrangements for us to be able to use the pool after hours. The reception helped load the phones for us as our cards were not being accepted in Sri Lanka. The beach has nice sitting benches to enjoy the sea. July is a rough month for the sea so we could not swim but the views were breathtaking. I am sure this hotel is more hustling and bustling in the tourist season. One advice, buy your own water when you come. Hotels give only 2 half litre bottles a day and if you need more you have to buy except during meal times. In July it is very hot and humid. The super market is close and there are many small souvenir shops in the area. Tuk tuks are available at the gate at all times. Overall a nice experience.
title: Overall a good experience with minor set backs

placeInfo: {'id': '10628005', 'name': 'Club Waskaduwa Beach Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 296, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.616225, 'longitude': 79.94573, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d10628005-Reviews-Club_Waskaduwa_Beach_Resort_Spa-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.clubwaskaduwabeachresort.com', 'address': '211 Jayanthi Mawatha (Parallel Road) Waskaduwa North, Waskaduwa, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '211 Jayanthi Mawatha (Parallel Road)', 'street2': 'Waskaduwa North, Waskaduwa', 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 35, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 37, 'count4': 71, 'count5': 132}}
text: I had a very disappointing stay at this hotel. There were vermin in the fresh mango juice at breakfast, and the service was poor. Flies and mosquitoes were everywhere and died flies and mosquitoes on the buffet table and in food, and the pool was unclean. placeInfo: {'id': '10628005', 'name': 'Club Waskaduwa Beach Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 296, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.616225, 'longitude': 79.94573, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d10628005-Reviews-Club_Waskaduwa_Beach_Resort_Spa-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.clubwaskaduwabeachresort.com', 'address': '211 Jayanthi Mawatha (Parallel Road) Waskaduwa North, Waskaduwa, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '211 Jayanthi Mawatha (Parallel Road)', 'street2': 'Waskaduwa North, Waskaduwa', 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 35, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 37, 'count4': 71, 'count5': 132}}
roomTip: When leaving the room bring valuables with yourself. Count your money so you know if something was stolen.
text: Be careful with your money. Dont even leave it in the safe box. Take it with you at all times, otherwise some will be probably stolen. I forgot my wallet in the room and 50‚Ç¨ banknote was stolen. They paid me back after telling this matter to the manager. They can open safebox too so dont use it. Staff is unresponsive. You need to ask multiple times for them to finally bring you stuff. We didnt have safebox, fridge, cups etc. All other things in this hotel were ok. Hotel needs renovation but if youre not very fancy then your stay will be fine.
title: Make sure to not leave valuable stuff inside the room!

placeInfo: {'id': '10628005', 'name': 'Club Waskaduwa Beach Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 296, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.616225, 'longitude': 79.94573, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d10628005-Reviews-Club_Waskaduwa_Beach_Resort_Spa-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.clubwaskaduwabeachresort.com', 'address': '211 Jayanthi Mawatha (Parallel Road) Waskaduwa North, Waskaduwa, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '211 Jayanthi Mawatha (Parallel Road)', 'street2': 'Waskaduwa North, Waskaduwa', 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 35, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 37, 'count4': 71, 'count5': 132}}
text: Garden view room comes with train noises! Hotel room was filled with little ants so don't leave anything eatable there. Toilet water button was very hard to push. Even we asked for clean towels every day during our stay there, the new towels were not very clean-it was not clear if they were washed or just dried. Our group also experienced some things gone missing from rooms. We had an sweet treat in the fridge-it went missing after the room cleaning. In other room a person had 600 rupeed next to computer-it was taken away. In the next room halp bottle on whiskey was taken away from the fridge and also 60 english pounds from the lock box. The breakfast was so-so, dinner was quite good. Overall-the hotel is quite new but it is not using it's true potential - Spa, rooftop restaurant and other restaurant is closed, room is little tired. Poolside was okay but if you plan to go to sea-be warned as the waves are high and locals try to sell you everything all the time.
title: Not the best but it is okay

placeInfo: {'id': '10628005', 'name': 'Club Waskaduwa Beach Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 296, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.616225, 'longitude': 79.94573, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d10628005-Reviews-Club_Waskaduwa_Beach_Resort_Spa-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.clubwaskaduwabeachresort.com', 'address': '211 Jayanthi Mawatha (Parallel Road) Waskaduwa North, Waskaduwa, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '211 Jayanthi Mawatha (Parallel Road)', 'street2': 'Waskaduwa North, Waskaduwa', 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 35, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 37, 'count4': 71, 'count5': 132}}
roomTip: Skip this hotel and change the place in the island downstares.
text:
Hotel pluses:

Very friendly and good hotel staff.
They let people bring their own drinks and brought them glasses and ice cream.
The room with a sea view was normal, comfortable bed, nice food.

Hotel minuses:
First if all the hotel does not match the photos. From the pictures tou can see that The hotel has a view of palm trees and a sea view, but it is actually overgrown with shrubs, the palm trees are cutting and the sea view is not even visible through the overgrown shrubs.
Bad location. The hotel is untidy and dirty. Sewage leaking in the middle of the hotel's lawn.
Beach towels are collected after the day, not washed but dried, and given to customers the next morning.
Rooms are not cleaning. 

Every day something keeps breaking or not working. If you ask to fix- they agree but do nothing. 

In general, I understand that Asia has different standards and procedures, but the hygiene here is very deplorable.

The beach are not comfortable and very unsightly.I will never come back to this hotel.;)
Every day russian music. No another music only russian.
title: Poor russian hotel

placeInfo: {'id': '316669', 'name': 'Hibiscus Beach Hotel', 'rating': 3.5, 'numberOfReviews': 246, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.615206, 'longitude': 79.946724, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d316669-Reviews-Hibiscus_Beach_Hotel-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.hibiscusbeachhotel.com/', 'address': 'Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': '', 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 21, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 43, 'count4': 86, 'count5': 75}}
roomTip: Rooms are old, doors creak, locks don't work, there is an odor in the room always.
text: We stayed at Hotel Hibiscus during a recent visit to Sri Lanka. The resort was located at a great location at Waskaduwa in Kalutara. The property featured rooms and villas with a swimming pool for adults and children. The villas had a seperate swimming pool as well. The check-in experience was decent. The rooms were a major let down, The walls were patched up and the bathroom ceiling showed signs of seepage with green spots quite prominent. The water had a sort of stink though the shower worked well and hot water was available all the while. The room had sand in the corners, the bed was not super comfortable though I would still give it a thumbs-up. The room service staff were hard working, but, well, if the walls and ceilings leak, what could they do? Another family reported a lizard in their room and their main switch tripped when they turned on the electric kettle. The electrician came down immediately and even offered to change the room, which was really great. The beach was next door, literally at stones throw distance and there were enough taps and mats to wash off sand. The breakfast spread was good, the lunch and dinner a-la-carte menu was quite decent. Plus point - EXCELLENT restaurant staff who helped adjust the meal for us. The swimming pools were really good. Major negative point - VISA cards did not work, only Mastercard did. The check-out experience was also decent. Overall, there are other resorts around, but the restaurant staff could be the only reason why I could recommend the resort to anybody. This place needs to be renovated ASAP!
title: Rickety rooms inside, awesome beach outside

placeInfo: {'id': '3310513', 'name': 'The Plantation Villa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 385, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.552944, 'longitude': 80.06062, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d3310513-Reviews-The_Plantation_Villa-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.srimalplantation.com', 'address': 'Wattalaya watta, Nehinna, Dodangoda, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wattalaya watta, Nehinna, Dodangoda', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 11, 'count4': 60, 'count5': 308}}
text: I booked the Ayurveda package at Plantation Villa for the second time, and after just 6 days, I felt like a completely new person! My room had a stunning jungle view, making it so peaceful and relaxing in the middle of nature. The Ayurvedic food was fantastic, and the treatments were top-notch. My therapist, Vasana, was always smiling, radiating the best vibes, and gave me the most amazing massages. She was so caring and attentive throughout my stay. Yoga and meditation with Bernardo were also incredible, adding to the overall rejuvenation. I highly recommend this place to anyone seeking a truly healing retreat!
title: Transformative Healing at Plantation Villa: A Rejuvenating 6-Day Ayurvedic Retreat in Nature's Embrace

placeInfo: {'id': '3310513', 'name': 'The Plantation Villa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 385, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.552944, 'longitude': 80.06062, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d3310513-Reviews-The_Plantation_Villa-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.srimalplantation.com', 'address': 'Wattalaya watta, Nehinna, Dodangoda, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wattalaya watta, Nehinna, Dodangoda', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 11, 'count4': 60, 'count5': 308}}
text: Stars at their Hereford UK site not Sri Lanka Very calm and interesting place to visit. Met some wonderfully interesting people around the dinner table. Treatments with Val were excellent. Rooms clean and adequate. Location charming. Meeting the Monk was very special. Food was set with tea freely available; Was enough for me but some were still a little hungry so something to consider if you have a large appetite. A great place to contemplate life
title: A special place to visit. I hope to go again

placeInfo: {'id': '3310513', 'name': 'The Plantation Villa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 385, 'locationString': 'Kalutara, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.552944, 'longitude': 80.06062, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304136-d3310513-Reviews-The_Plantation_Villa-Kalutara_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.srimalplantation.com', 'address': 'Wattalaya watta, Nehinna, Dodangoda, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wattalaya watta, Nehinna, Dodangoda', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kalutara', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 11, 'count4': 60, 'count5': 308}}
text: I wanted to say I had a wonderful stay at Plantation villa. I went due to serious back pain that I had been having for many many months that no dr. could tell me why and what was wrong.  I decided to take some time off to rest and do some natural treatments and see how things went.  The time there was so restful and full of the kindest people and very nice treatments. All the oil massages were great for my back pain. I learned a lot through discussions with Barnardo who manages the place, teaches yoga and also gives very interesting talks on so many different subjects.  No idea where he gets his wisdom, but guessing its a gift. I was kind of down due to my back pain but he kept encouraging me that from all he could see and tell, I for sure would get better but it was going to take time. I just want to say at the time of writing this I am 100% better and so very happy and thankful to not be in pain! Thank you all there for all the care you showed me and all I learned and most of all for helping me on my healing journey. I know I benefited greatly from that time!  Be blessed and THANK YOU!
title: Thank you Plantation villa!

placeInfo: {'id': '10422418', 'name': 'Jie Jie Beach by Jetwing', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 677, 'locationString': 'Panadura, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.70331, 'longitude': 79.905975, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1097569-d10422418-Reviews-Jie_Jie_Beach_by_Jetwing-Panadura_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jiejiebeach.com', 'address': '150 Beach Road Uyankelle, Panadura 12500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '150 Beach Road', 'street2': 'Uyankelle', 'city': 'Panadura', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 32, 'count3': 82, 'count4': 179, 'count5': 334}}
roomTip: We don't recommend this hotel
text:
We held an event at Jie Jie by Jetwing on October 26 and, unfortunately, were disappointed by the experience, especially considering the superb service we had received in previous years. Although we don‚Äôt expect five-star standards, our past events at Jie Jie by Jetwing since 2018 had been handled excellently. However, with the recent management change, the service quality and overall experience seem to have noticeably declined.

Firstly, while Mr. Eric and Champika made commendable efforts, certain issues impacted our event.

The handling of the event‚Äôs end time by Mr. Wasantha felt unprofessional‚Äîthough we had agreed on a midnight end, he began pressuring us to stop the band as early as 11:15 p.m. This created unnecessary stress and disruption.

Additionally, despite providing 10 kg of dry bites, 15 kg of guava, and 160 green apples, only a few plates were served in the Grand Ballroom, making us question if our items were served as agreed. Furthermore, staff often cleared plates and glasses without checking if they were still in use, disrupting our guests‚Äô experience.

The driver meal was substandard, not in line with what we'd expect from a star-class hotel. Some staff members even spoke rudely to our team, including senior managers, and the overall attitude felt rushed, as if the staff were eager for the event to end. Due to the rain, we wanted to use the indoor entrance to the ballroom, but staff discouraged this, causing inconvenience.

We were also charged unexpectedly an additional Rs. 25,000 for electricity, which we had assumed was included in our package.

An extra 24 bottles of soft drinks were billed without our authorization, which led to unapproved additional costs.

There was a significant water leak in the ballroom due to heavy rain, We intended to block one door of the Grand Ball Room, but the lock was broken, the key card for one of our rooms failed, and our team had to wait nearly an hour for access. The maintenance team eventually opened the door manually, attributing the issue to a dead lock battery and an unpleasant odor in the hall, all of which affected the ambiance of our event.

Overall, despite some staff efforts, our experience didn‚Äôt meet expectations.
title: Disappointing Experience at Jie Jie by Jetwing

placeInfo: {'id': '10422418', 'name': 'Jie Jie Beach by Jetwing', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 677, 'locationString': 'Panadura, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.70331, 'longitude': 79.905975, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1097569-d10422418-Reviews-Jie_Jie_Beach_by_Jetwing-Panadura_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jiejiebeach.com', 'address': '150 Beach Road Uyankelle, Panadura 12500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '150 Beach Road', 'street2': 'Uyankelle', 'city': 'Panadura', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 32, 'count3': 82, 'count4': 179, 'count5': 334}}
text:
This is my 3rd visit. Came with my friends with their families. It has peace and calm environment and had a great time. Extremely good and helpful staff. Foods was tasty, rooms and pool was clean.

placeInfo: {'id': '10422418', 'name': 'Jie Jie Beach by Jetwing', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 677, 'locationString': 'Panadura, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.70331, 'longitude': 79.905975, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1097569-d10422418-Reviews-Jie_Jie_Beach_by_Jetwing-Panadura_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jiejiebeach.com', 'address': '150 Beach Road Uyankelle, Panadura 12500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '150 Beach Road', 'street2': 'Uyankelle', 'city': 'Panadura', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 32, 'count3': 82, 'count4': 179, 'count5': 334}}
text:
Our stay at Jie Jie Beach by Jetwing in Panadura was a delightful retreat for the whole family. As we've come to expect, reserving a suite provided us the comfort and space we needed, with pleasant interiors and a good standard of amenities that elevated our stay above the average.

The culinary experience at Jie Jie Beach was commendable. The food was consistently good, with a nice variety in the buffet spread that appealed to all of us. Whether it was breakfast, lunch, or dinner, each meal was enjoyable and well-prepared, contributing to a wholesome dining experience throughout our stay.

The pool area was a hit with the kids. It was well-maintained and provided endless fun under the sun, ensuring that our little ones were entertained and happy. The beach, just a stone's throw away, was clean and serene, perfect for building sandcastles or simply enjoying the coastal vibe.

Overall, Jie Jie Beach by Jetwing in Panadura proved to be a wonderful choice for a family getaway. While our experience was a bit above average, the setting, coupled with the good food and suite comforts, made it a worthwhile escape. It‚Äôs a place we‚Äôd happily recommend to families looking for a beachside vacation where both kids and adults can relax and enjoy.
title: Sunny Days at Jie Jie Beach by Jetwing, Panadura

placeInfo: {'id': '10422418', 'name': 'Jie Jie Beach by Jetwing', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 677, 'locationString': 'Panadura, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.70331, 'longitude': 79.905975, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1097569-d10422418-Reviews-Jie_Jie_Beach_by_Jetwing-Panadura_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jiejiebeach.com', 'address': '150 Beach Road Uyankelle, Panadura 12500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '150 Beach Road', 'street2': 'Uyankelle', 'city': 'Panadura', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 32, 'count3': 82, 'count4': 179, 'count5': 334}}
text:
Another one of Jetwing‚Äôs stays that won‚Äôt let you down! I don‚Äôt need to emphasize enough that the view is beautiful as always. It‚Äôs the perfect location to chill at the beach or to go for a walk early morning or in the evening. Whether you choose to watch the sunset from the room or down at the beach, it‚Äôll be stunning either way.
The staff were friendly and helpful, as it is in most of Jetwing‚Äôs locations. The spa was absolutely amazing! They will guide you through to choose the exact treatment you need. The only thing is sometimes there will be only male staff at the spa. If this is a concern, check with them in advance.
Getting to the food - the buffets were amazing. The pastries were exceptional and there were always decent options for vegetarians. 
The only reason I‚Äôm giving one star less is the bathroom. It wasn‚Äôt great, small leak and could‚Äôve been better.
Overall, would totally visit again!
title: Worth going back!

text: Visiting Sri Lanka for a vacation, My wife and I wanted to take our families out for a hotel stay not far off from Colombo and Jetwing Jie Jie fit the bill. placeInfo: {'id': '10422418', 'name': 'Jie Jie Beach by Jetwing', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 677, 'locationString': 'Panadura, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.70331, 'longitude': 79.905975, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1097569-d10422418-Reviews-Jie_Jie_Beach_by_Jetwing-Panadura_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jiejiebeach.com', 'address': '150 Beach Road Uyankelle, Panadura 12500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '150 Beach Road', 'street2': 'Uyankelle', 'city': 'Panadura', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 32, 'count3': 82, 'count4': 179, 'count5': 334}}
text:
I booked a double room and a triple room for 5 people and checked in around 6pm; the initial service was excellent, as provided by 'Sithmini' from the front desk, who greeted us warmly and assigned us a room within 10 minutes; however, the room was terrible; the AC was not working, and there was no signal coverage throughout the hotel, which was fine except for the AC!!!!!

We informed the front desk, and yes, they changed our room to the next door, but the AC was still the same; we just ignored it for the time being and ordered food from the hotel restaurant, which was a Chicken Fried Rice Rs.1800 with cardboard papadam and dry rice; we also ordered a boneless chicken, but the restaurant call operator asked what we meant by boneless. Wtf, the hotel restaurant doesn't know what boneless is, so we said, "Yako, it's Katu nathi chicken," and he was like, "Ahh, okay, okay."

Still we bared everything and didn't even complain about those but when we check-out and waiting for the bill to be processed all of a sudden a hotel staff comes and says that a 'Body Lotion' is missing from the room, I was like okay so what? the person said that like I have a stolen a TV or a iron from the room, the person humiliated me Infront of my friends and other people, I have stayed in countless hotels all over Sri Lanka and I have used all the equipment's and products the hotel provides which is complimentary and which can be taken home but this hotel doesn't even let a customer who paid around 60-70k per night to take a ' Small Body Lotion' which I used during the stay, I was really annoyed and dissatisfied with the overall service the hotel gave us, idk what has happened to the Jetwing Hotel Chain.

Even the final bill was messed up; I paid the room bill when I checked in, and the final bill was only the bar and restaurant bill, but the person charged me again for the rooms and gave me a receipt for my card; again, they reimbursed the amount to my card, and I waited for more than 15 minutes, which made me think I would never come to Jetwing again or recommend anyone, not even an enemy; I hope Jetwing management looks into this.
title: Worst customer service in a Beautiful place.

placeInfo: {'id': '10422418', 'name': 'Jie Jie Beach by Jetwing', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 677, 'locationString': 'Panadura, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.70331, 'longitude': 79.905975, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1097569-d10422418-Reviews-Jie_Jie_Beach_by_Jetwing-Panadura_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jiejiebeach.com', 'address': '150 Beach Road Uyankelle, Panadura 12500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '150 Beach Road', 'street2': 'Uyankelle', 'city': 'Panadura', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 32, 'count3': 82, 'count4': 179, 'count5': 334}}
roomTip: Please Check whether the sea view is available before reserve your room because other views arent giving the best
text:
Overall it was a great experience .Had a warm welcome and got the room sharply on time.Location is really good and can access in to it quickly .

Maintenance staff and front office  quys are really good and helpful .To keep our birthday cake in cool place maintenance department bought a mini frig to the room soon after i informed.

Giant pool can accomadate many people so no more rush over there.

Room was well equipped no need to ask for Iron or hair dryer separately from the front desk.

During our checkout and for other backoffice work sithmini helped us well in a professional way with a pleasant smile.Keep up your positive attitude 

To improve the quality further i would like to make few suggestions.
1.Room lock in our room wasnt smooth and rooms arent well sound proofed .even courridor  chats also can hear in side to the room.
If houskeeping department can focus much more detail attention in to the cleaning it would be great.
title: Had a good experience over JIE JIE

text:
First off I must say, the buffet was the absolute BEST! We enjoyed it so much. It was exceptional except that we weren't that satisfied about the service at breakfast. Overall, the buffet was GOOD.

The room was splendid, it was really spacious and we enjoyed the sea view a lot. The beds and pillows were really comfy :)

The pool was gigantic and many small details to experience there. It was cool.

The hotel service was amazing. And the front officer, Ms. Sithmini's services are highly appreciated and she was really friendly and supportive throughout.

Overall, Jie Jie By Jetwing is a  brilliant hotel for an amazing stay that really knows to maintain their star rate! ü§©

Thank you very much!

text: Thank you Blue Beach Hotel Bentota team for making our Group Srilanka trip  comfortable and enjoyable  .. Rooms were good. Breakfast and dinner menu was fine and tasty with pleasant and courteous staff .. special word for Ms Sue from the Management team at the Reception who was very cheerful and positive all the time to ensure comfort of the Guests .. She and her team  remained in daily touch with us and ensured overall efficiency and care for us .. Must mention also about Mr Rangana incharge Restaurant who was always with a smile serving us .The Chef Chandra again is a praiseworthy person . We would love to visit Sri lanka now more frequently and also pass on details to our extended Group friends who may wish to visit Sri Lanka...Keep the good work going Hotel Blue Beach and Ms Sue . Rgds .Colonel Vinod Myne New Delhi
title: GREAT STAY AT BLUE BEACH

placeInfo: {'id': '586453', 'name': 'The Blue Water', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2587, 'locationString': 'Wadduwa, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.6776, 'longitude': 79.920364, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g499081-d586453-Reviews-The_Blue_Water-Wadduwa_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.bluewatersrilanka.com/', 'address': 'Thalpitiya, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Thalpitiya', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Wadduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12560'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 68, 'count2': 90, 'count3': 187, 'count4': 644, 'count5': 1598}}
roomTip: Great Ocean Front Hotel , near Colombo
text:
I was at Blue Water Hotel Spa - Oct 4- 6- 2024 , with friends .
 The Event was to Celebrate the Diamond Anniversary of Class of 64- University of Ceylon -- ie how it was named back then in 1964.
 Most of us now 80 + yrs arrived at Blue Water Hotel from all over the globe -

  The location was picked due to its proximity to Colombo,  well designed ( Bevis Bawa Design ) smaller hotel, with rooms at ground and level 2 mostly, spaces areas for socialization with a ocean breeze on the areas, nice Grand Ball Room for the Saturday Night Celebration ,  Organization of the  Group Photo , 
 Spaceous out side verendha area of the  Dining area, again great spot for small groups for socialization .
 Lovely Ocean front , great beach walks , beautiful garden  and pool well cared for, many parrots singing for us at twilight as they come to roost on the  many lighted coconut trees , looking like Singing  Christmas Lights !

 Gracious Thanks to Mr Shannon De Zilva of Blue Water Hotel -  Head  office in Colombo, with out whose  extremely patient and tolerant help over the past 10 months of planning, this event would never have got off the ground  !
 Co -ordinating such an event , with members, who are 80 + yrs , now  scattered around the globe was no easy task, and Mr De Zilva stepped up to the plate and helped us out, ironing out many creases along the way .
 Thank You Mr De Zilva and his Head Office Team .  

 The  Front Desk  Hotel Staff -- extremely gracious and again , very tolerant  at the  time we all descended upon them almost at the same time !

 Special mention to -  Ishani( Guest Relations )  Kushani,  Shamali,  Shakila ( Operator ) .
 Shakila -- my Special Thanks to you, for the help you gave me,  ( Deepthie Vyjanthimala !! ) making  up the Araliya Mal Mala for the Saturday night concert !
title: Great Experience of a Group Gathering at a  Lovey Ocean Front Hotel , close proximity to Colombo, yet far from the city

placeInfo: {'id': '586453', 'name': 'The Blue Water', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2587, 'locationString': 'Wadduwa, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.6776, 'longitude': 79.920364, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g499081-d586453-Reviews-The_Blue_Water-Wadduwa_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.bluewatersrilanka.com/', 'address': 'Thalpitiya, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Thalpitiya', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Wadduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12560'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 68, 'count2': 90, 'count3': 187, 'count4': 644, 'count5': 1598}}
roomTip: Pop across the railway line to book your trips with Ruchi Tours !
text:
We have recently had a return visit to this wonderful hotel to celebrate our 12th Wedding anniversary in the place we married in 2012.
All the wonderful staff went above and beyond to make our stay and in particular our anniversary a truly auspicious occasion.
Duminda , kushani, Ravin, Dinnesh and all the lovely staff in the restaurant and behind the scenes were faultless .
We were given the same great room we had stayed in 12 years ago , our anniversary meal was exceptional and our overall stay most comfortable and enjoyable.
The buffet is lovely in the evenings and breakfasts excellent.
The gardens are immaculate and the beach clean and enjoyable to stroll along. The sea tends to be quite rough so not good for swimming or snorkeling at this time of year.
We will certainly be returning and hopefully sooner .
A big thank you to all.  Our only suggestion going forwards is perhaps some new poolside parasols and tables needed .
title: A fabulous stay , again !

text:
We stayed 23-24 September on our brief return from UK to SL. It is our second time in Blue Waters after our honeymoon stay in 2022. The hotel has the same relaxing atmosphere. The best thing is they treat with same respect/courtesy/and hospitability for the Sri Lankans which is the best thing about Blue Waters.

The front line office manager gave us the Bawa tour which was really nice, and all the meticulous details about its architectural grandeur. With regard to dinning, I wished if there could be more varieties of rice and other dishes for dinner and breakfast taking into account the Sri Lankan guests. I am saying this in comparison our dinning experiences in the year 2022 (May)

I must especially mention about G.S Sanjeewa the supervisor of the restaurant. He was such a nice company. His small talks with great courtesy and full of friendliness,  made our dinning experience richer and fuller. Such a lovely hospitable, welcoming gestures from staff like Sanjeewa, make us to feel come again, which we will definitely do next year.
title: Great Hotel and Lovely Staff

text:
I wanted to stay at a nice hotel with my father to give him nice time after his surgery. I visited hotel one day before we checked in. I would thank to the staff of The Blue Water from the front desk to the restaurant. They were friendly and helpful to full filled my wish. Specially Mr. Sanjeewa,  the supervisor of restaurant was very helpful and kind to arrange healthy meals for my father according to my wish. Mis Tharaka, the senior hostess of the hotel arranged things during my stay at the hotel. Their friendliness and hospitality are gifts to the hotel as I feel.
All in all my experience in the Blue Water Hotel was excellent because these kind of friendly people. I recommend this beautiful beach front hotel to all who wish to spend their vacation in Sri Lanka.
title: Appreciation for the good service.

placeInfo: {'id': '586453', 'name': 'The Blue Water', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2587, 'locationString': 'Wadduwa, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.6776, 'longitude': 79.920364, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g499081-d586453-Reviews-The_Blue_Water-Wadduwa_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.bluewatersrilanka.com/', 'address': 'Thalpitiya, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Thalpitiya', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Wadduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12560'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 68, 'count2': 90, 'count3': 187, 'count4': 644, 'count5': 1598}}
text: Absolute tropic heaven after being transferred from another hotel where we had a bad experience. The rooms were very spacious, had bathrobes, iron with board, tea station, fresh filtered water everyday, smart tv and comfortable beds. The only con is the window connecting from the room into the bathroom. The breakfast and dinner buffet never disappointed. Staff provide filtered water at the restaurants. All the staff were very friendly and always willing to help. The pool is very clean and showers available to rinse off afterwards. The beach was very beautiful and 3 minute walk away from our room. Unfortunately, it was off season so the ocean was not safe to swim in. Still beautiful to watch though. Saw a herd of cows running along the beach which was an absolute delight to watch. You see over 100 green parrots arriving in the evening and sitting in the palm trees near the beach. I also recommend the hotel spa. I had lots of aches and pains from the trip and long flights. I felt like a new person after a Balinese massage. It was a very unique hotel and one of the best I have ever stayed at.
title: Tropic Heaven

placeInfo: {'id': '586453', 'name': 'The Blue Water', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2587, 'locationString': 'Wadduwa, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.6776, 'longitude': 79.920364, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g499081-d586453-Reviews-The_Blue_Water-Wadduwa_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.bluewatersrilanka.com/', 'address': 'Thalpitiya, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Thalpitiya', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Wadduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12560'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 68, 'count2': 90, 'count3': 187, 'count4': 644, 'count5': 1598}}
roomTip: Make this your longest stay!
text:
We, a group of four girls, ended our Sri Lankan tour with an idyllic stay for 4 nights at The Blue Water Hotel and Spa. This hotel was just what we needed after a long trip around Sri Lanka. Absolutely everything was first class - from the managers, the customer service at reception, the porters, to the catering and housekeeping staff, everyone went out of their way to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. No job was too big for anyone. The warm bright smiles and attentive nature of all staff made us feel at home. In particular, the managers, Dumindu and Kushani were exceptional in their leadership. The  reception staff, Shakila, Chamika, and Dilshan were always on hand for anything we needed. 

The spacious rooms, with a private garden leading to the swimming pool was a dream. Clean rooms, lovely bathroom amenities, smart TV all added to the experience. The beds were so comfortable, that we slept in most mornings! Yet the staff at breakfast still accommodated past the breakfast time. The garden/pool views from the room were so relaxing, I felt like I was in tropic heaven! 

The food was mouth watering and delicious. Something I looked forward to every morning and evening. The variety of choice with the fruits and salads, the mains and desserts, everything was cooked to perfection. I have a dairy allergy, so the staff would let me know what dessert options were suitable for me.

I would highly recommend this hotel. I cannot fault this place in any way! A must stay.
title: An idyllic stay

placeInfo: {'id': '586453', 'name': 'The Blue Water', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2587, 'locationString': 'Wadduwa, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.6776, 'longitude': 79.920364, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g499081-d586453-Reviews-The_Blue_Water-Wadduwa_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.bluewatersrilanka.com/', 'address': 'Thalpitiya, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Thalpitiya', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Wadduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12560'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 68, 'count2': 90, 'count3': 187, 'count4': 644, 'count5': 1598}}
text:
We recently spent 10 days at The Blue Water, Wadduwa, in August 2024, and overall, we had an absolutely delightful experience. While we wouldn't classify this as a 5-star hotel by international standards, we were very satisfied with our stay.

The hotel boasts stunning architecture, featuring large open spaces that beautifully blend the indoors with the outdoors. Although the hotel shows signs of age and could benefit from some modernization, the overall ambiance and setting were incredible.

Dining:
The hotel offers both √† la carte and buffet dining options. The buffet consistently featured a mix of "Western" cuisine, Indian dishes, and local Sri Lankan specialties. The variety and quality of the food were excellent, with flavors that truly delighted our taste buds. The selection of beverages was also more than satisfactory.

Service:
The hotel staff were consistently friendly, smiling, and helpful throughout our stay.

Facilities:
The outdoor areas, including the beach, were clean and well-maintained. The pool was large and kept in excellent condition. There were always enough sunbeds available, and the attentive staff were quick to prepare them for us as soon as we approached.

A special thank you goes to Aruna and his team at the Pool Bar. His warm hospitality truly enhanced our stay‚ÄîAruna, a big thank you!

A Few Tips for Improvement:

- The hotel would benefit from a planned and gradual modernization process.
- The preparation time for meals and drinks in the √† la carte restaurant was relatively long, even though the hotel was not busy during our stay (off-season). It might be worth considering better kitchen management. However, the wait was ultimately worth it as the food was delicious.
title: Wonderful Stay with a Few Areas for Improvement

placeInfo: {'id': '586453', 'name': 'The Blue Water', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2587, 'locationString': 'Wadduwa, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.6776, 'longitude': 79.920364, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g499081-d586453-Reviews-The_Blue_Water-Wadduwa_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.bluewatersrilanka.com/', 'address': 'Thalpitiya, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Thalpitiya', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Wadduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12560'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 68, 'count2': 90, 'count3': 187, 'count4': 644, 'count5': 1598}}
text: It was a great vacation, thanks to the hotel. I was there in December. I first want to say a great thank for organizing my birthday especially to the employee Milan from the food and beverage department. He did everything to make my birthday unforgettable. He is very cool, responsible and highly qualified worker. Also thank the reception worker for the good service. The food is great and varied , the desserts are excellent! Abundance of everyday seafood and fruits. Fruit paradise. The Hostess Tharaka and Dilini  they did a very good job. Every morning they greeted us with an amazing smile. All the waiters provided very good service, especially Dinik. He is very polite, responsive and pleasant person. There are squirrels running around the territory, there are a lot of birds, which delighted everyone. In the evenings there is live music or a dance show from the local culture. Another huge thank you to the cleaning service,  which cleans the rooms very well every day and special thank to Sandaruwan for his work. He is a very kind and wonderful hotel employee. I am amazed by the hotel's service, the kindness of the people and the highly qualified staff. Thank you, The Bleu Water for an amazing holiday.
title: An unforgettable holiday at The Blue Water.

text: We attended the Blue Water in Wadduwa due to our friends getting married in a villa nearby. I was incredibly impressed by this beautiful hotel! Staff were so friendly, warm and accommodating. The pool and grounds are stunning. Breakfast was very nice as well (although on our second day, staff were slightly slow to clear tables). The food at dinner was good and drinks were well made. Our room, though slightly older, was still clean and well decorated. Reception staff could not be more helpful. If you ever visit Sri Lanka, you should stay here!
title: A beautiful and scenic hotel with excellent staff

A bit late but here it is....             Second time in 2 years.....feels like coming home.
Nice room with a view over the ocean, spacious enough to get lost.
Nice beds with new matrasses and good pillows, jacuzzi included.
Being welcommed by the staff who recognized us from last year.
Even more choice for breakfast, diner and souper, now with Sri Lankan specialities !
Every meal with show-cooking.
Very helpfull staff in the restaurant....a big thanks to Aruna, Akila and Shadish for providing an excellent service in the restaurant. 
They make it unforgetable !
The pool....my goodness....wat these guys are providing....the pool staff friendly as usual and very helpfull.
We see each other in the future !
title: A must do in Sri Lanka !

text:
We stayed at the Blue Water in March 2024 for 2 nights. The service, rooms and buffet breakfast was incredible! 

The staff were very polite, attentive and always willing to make ]our stay that extra special. 

The rooms were very extremely clean, well maintained and served as the best place for a relaxing holiday.

The buffet breakfast had a huge spread of Sri Lankan, Western, Asian delicacies. The food was well presented and tasted very good! 

The location is serene and beautiful. If you are looking for a place to unwind and enjoy the beautiful Sri Lankan beaches, this hotel will cater for all your needs. No regrets and will be returning here again !
title: Amazing Experience

text:
Just returned from a fantastic holiday at this hotel, the staff really made it and couldn't do any more for you.  They were always welcoming and helpful wherever you went within the complex.

Our room was sea facing with the most fantastic views and was cleaned every day with a constant change of bed linen and towels.  2 bottles of drinking water was provided every day and the attention to detail including rearranging our collection of shells into a "love heart":)

We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis which was more than adequate with an extensive menu every day.  It was my birthday whilst we were there and the birthday cake and the good wishes and singing of "happy birthday" from the staff was greatly appreciated and fun.

Thank you Blue Water for making our first visit to Sri Lanka for a memorable visit.
title: Staff are the key to this Hotel

placeInfo: {'id': '586453', 'name': 'The Blue Water', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2587, 'locationString': 'Wadduwa, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.6776, 'longitude': 79.920364, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g499081-d586453-Reviews-The_Blue_Water-Wadduwa_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.bluewatersrilanka.com/', 'address': 'Thalpitiya, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Thalpitiya', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Wadduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12560'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 68, 'count2': 90, 'count3': 187, 'count4': 644, 'count5': 1598}}
text:
We stayed at The Blue Water at the end of April this year and had a wonderful time. We have stayed here on many occasions and am delighted to say that standards in all areas were excellent. The GM Mr Gihan and his team work very hard to ensure all guests needs are met or exceeded and we have very good reason to say that ours were certainly far exceeded. When we arrived at Colombo airport we did so minus our luggage, and with no help form the airline to locate it or indeed to offer any emergency help. We got to the hotel frustrated and tired and were met by the the amazing serenity of the place, and from there Ms Kushani stepped in and took over. Without this amazing lady we would never have redeemed our luggage nor indeed been able to have our wedding at the sister location Glenross Living. Ms Kushani went went way beyond expectation and we will be forever thankful to her.

We found the whole team at the hotel to be extremely helpful in every respect, other people to mention are Duminda as part of the front of house staff who was always on hand to answer any queries or to ensure any issues were dealt with quickly, our housekeeper Sujit ensured our room was always immaculate and he always did it with a great big smile.

The food quality at the Blue Water is incredible, we mostly ate in the buffet restaurant and the choice of dishes ranging from western to Sri Lankan was amazing. Felis one of the restaurant managers was always on hand to make sure that you enjoyed everything.

The hotel gardens and pool area were looking really great and it is a joy to be there. We had a great stay and look forward to seeing everyone on our return.
title: Such a lovely place to be

text:
We ended our 14 day tour of Sri Lanka with a five night stay here. It was as we expected quiet, relaxing and just what we needed after a very busy, hectic 11 days.
As we have found in all the hotels we have stayed in during our trip the service, welcome and friendliness was excellent. 
The food,both buffet and a la carte, was very good. 
Our flight home wasn't until 11pm and the hotel gave us our room with a late check out of 3pm which was great. Just enough time to have a late lunch in the bar before our taxi to the airport.n

A lovely end to our fabulous holiday, thank you.
title: Five night stay to end our tour of Sri Lanka

text: The rooms are very comfortable and despite initial misgivings we were not bothered by the trains on the nearby railway line.  The hotel enjoys access to a beautiful beach/sunsets and also a very welcome swimming pool.  The staff were all extremely friendly and courteous and are a credit to the hotel.  Any minor snags with our room were soon rectified through willing and attentive service.  The food was of a variable in standard; the buffet on our first evening was very good but when reverting to a la carte (evenings of low hotel occupancy) the quality suffered.  Overall, The Villas were a very relaxing end to our fantastic Sri Lankan holiday - thank you.
title: Relaxing Hotel By Pool

placeInfo: {'id': '13493984', 'name': 'The Villas Wadduwa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 236, 'locationString': 'Wadduwa, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.67429, 'longitude': 79.92219, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g499081-d13493984-Reviews-The_Villas_Wadduwa-Wadduwa_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.boutiquecollectionbyamaya.com/villas-wadduwa/', 'address': '4/352 Rathnayake Road Thalpitiya South, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '4/352 Rathnayake Road', 'street2': 'Thalpitiya South', 'city': 'Wadduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12560'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 10, 'count4': 36, 'count5': 183}}
roomTip: Ask for a room nearer the sea
text:
The last hotel on our Secret  Escapes  holiday , organised locally by HOT ( House of Hotel and Tourism) so due to stay five nights. 

Good things:
Waiting staff very friendly.
Large room with balcony , a/c and ceiling fan. 
Swimming pool ,warm and peaceful. Over 30 sun-loungers
Did a great job of washing and ironing clothes at a reasonable price.
Food was a buffet when there were more guests and set menu when there were less.
Beautifully maintained gardens. 
Husband enjoyed his back massage. 

Not so good:
Had to be moved due to train noise ( nearest reception), Wi-Fi not working and fridge not being cold ( even in the new room the fridge was never cold enough). Wi-Fi dipped up several times over the days
This was the only place where I was bitten by mosquitoes even while wearing repellent.
Gym machines not working
No information at front desk re local activities 
Very isolated

Worse thing for us was that we would have had a 12 hour wait after check out until we were collected to go to the airport seating In reception that had no a/c or even fans. HOT moved us to Columbo so we had an air con room in another hotel in which to wait. Great service from them . 

Sea was too rough to swim in September, which we didn‚Äôt know. Would have preferred to have stayed at some of the other hotels for more nights, where there was more to do and see.
title: Two nights here would have been enough

text:
Wonderful Hotel, with a beautiful green garden complex. We stayed 6 nights as a young couple.

Everyone here is super friendly and makes you feel welcomed. The waiters, the whole kitchen staff and the barkeeper are doing a great job, are always ready to help and are concerned that everything is satisfactory. The food was great!

What we really appreciated was the calm atmosphere. It was never crowded or loud, you could really relax. Although some other reviews complained about train noises, we didn‚Äòt find the train anyhow disturbing. It only operates during daytime, not early mornings, and is not even loud.

Fully recommend! We loved it!

text:
Great Hotel with nice rooms and an outdoor bathroom in the private accommodations which I personally like alot.  Sadly we visited in June so the pool was quite hot and the ocean to wavy to take a bath. But we were told that changes between November and February. Bring additional bug spray for the Mosquitoes though. 

Especially noteworthy is the Staff. We asked the Chef of the Restaurant if he could cook our favorite singalese dish for us and he did so for the rest of our stay. He even wrote down the recipe for us. 

The rest of the staff was no less friendly or helpful. Even the gardeners. Fuethermore the whole hotel area is just beautiful.

Sadly some drinks at the bar wasn't available during our stay of 4 days
title: Beautiful hotel with very friendly staff!

text:
Lovely place to stay! We lucked out on the weather but had a dip in the pool the day we were leaving. Chef Dinesh, Viraj, Kasuu are just a few who made our stay extra special with their warmth and kindness. 

Sri Lanka is an amazing place to visit. It's beauty has humbled us. We enjoyes the scenery, the food and everything they had to offer. 

When the aircon wasn't working properly we were given another room to choose, the chef made a special local meal for us which we were dying for, they helped make my birthday extra special, we were able to check out very late, our taxi came at 14.00. All these small things made a difference. 

Thanks to everybody, whish we had written and remembered every single name. We would love to come back. 

Best wishes
title: Love

roomTip:
Only one or two nights. 
Check a/c in room before unpacking 
Nothing to do in the area.
text:
The hotel is well kept. 
Excellent gardens and pool. 
Lots of staff. 
Room A/C temperamental.
The phone needed updating
4 bottles water left daily. 
Balcony great. Would recommend not ground floor. 
The food is good. The staff in restaurant are good. 
The food not always hot. 
No UV ü•≤fly killers. 
Restaurant outside. 
So lots flies about. 
Fridge in room more bottle chiller not up to the job. 
The pool bar service is nonexistent plus only a few sun beds. 
Wine expensive by the bottle. 
The beach by the hotel is kept clean. 
But with lots staff WHY can‚Äôt one be asked to walk 500 yards each side and pick up the rubbish. Plastic mainly. That spoils the beach for all. 
The locals don‚Äôt seem to see rubbish. Lighting at night going back to room poor sometimes off. 
There is little to do. 
The main road is death trap. 
Would not stay again. No entertainment. 
Lots and lots staff. Maybe stronger management needed. To spruce up the place in all ways. 
Uber works in the area. Used it and was happy. Very cheap to get into columbo. 
So recommended for one night really, on way to or from airport
title: Good Hotel. Would only recommend 2 nights maximum

text:
A superb way to end a trip around Sri Lanka. Quiet and tranquil, accommodation is arranged in separate villas which were very clean and plentiful with toiletries. The pool area had lots of sun beds and there was direct access to the beach. We walked in both directions along the expansive sand and enjoyed the strong waves and breeze. Exciting to watch the local fishermen bringing in their catch and the watch the sun set at the end of each day. 
The buffet restaurant had a good choice and the staff were attentive and friendly.
title: Paradise by the sea

roomTip: If afraid of mozzies, consider an upstairs room. Also some of the downstairs rooms have patios that afford very little privacy.
text: At the end of our island tour we landed here for 5 nights. Small hotel with individual villas located within peaceful gardens right on the beach. Rooms were a decent size and reasonably clean. Bathroom was in need of renovation but fully functional with a powerful shower.  Everyone had their own terrace or patio which was just as well as there weren‚Äôt enough sun beds around the pool [I reckon 16]. Kinda weird given there‚Äôs nothing else to do. There‚Äôs a small quiet road just at the front of the hotel adjacent to the railway line. You can walk about 15 mins to the left or 25 mins to the right and then cut down to the beach to walk back to the hotel. There‚Äôs a couple of little shops across the railway line which are worth a visit. Breakfast and dinner were served in the. Open air restaurant and we always found something tasty to eat. Thanks to Tharindu and Harikesh for their great service and attention to detail. If you want something special, maybe a lobster dinner, that can be arranged with the restaurant manager for a small consideration.  We had a minor blip in our bill on departure so I recommend you get a copy on the night before departure so u can check for any discrepancies rather than at the last minute when your taxi is waiting.
title: Quiet spacious hotel right on the beach.

text:
Poor hotel; we were moved from the original choice.  Not in a tourist area at all; nothing to do.  Only entertainment is one pool table.  Poolside, only have 20 sun loungers for a 40 room hotel - why?? especially as there was the space... plus bugs, ants that nip and bite.... pool water temp like a bath.
Food good but bar drinks choice very limited, and service so so slow - why don't they come round the pool and ask what you would like; you have to go find them and it's not as if the drinks were part of an included package.
Beach pretty but not useable, too steep, rough sea and under sand black.
Room air conditioning very noisy (and that was after a room change because our first room a.c. did not work)..
title: Last stop on a jewel of a Sri Lanka tour experience.

placeInfo: {'id': '13493984', 'name': 'The Villas Wadduwa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 236, 'locationString': 'Wadduwa, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.67429, 'longitude': 79.92219, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g499081-d13493984-Reviews-The_Villas_Wadduwa-Wadduwa_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.boutiquecollectionbyamaya.com/villas-wadduwa/', 'address': '4/352 Rathnayake Road Thalpitiya South, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '4/352 Rathnayake Road', 'street2': 'Thalpitiya South', 'city': 'Wadduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12560'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 10, 'count4': 36, 'count5': 183}}
text:
Dear team @ The Villas, Wadduwa, 

Ms Ishani at the front desk, Rukman as our room cleaner and the head chef along with the Sous Chef and everyone else made our 4 night stay extremely comfortable. (26th Dec - 30th Dec 2023) 

Right from the start with the Tamarind juice as a welcome drink to the final bill, everything was extremely personal. 

We were travelling with an 18 month old baby and special care was taken to provide us with milk and baby food at our request. 

The resort had a warmth to it only due to the staff. 

The buffets for breakfast and dinners (we took half boarding) were just perfect. Despite all of us guests being from different parts of the world they catered to almost everyone's taste. 

Overall a very memorable stay only due to the sstaff at The Villas. Great place to stay.
title: Wonderful personal service stay

roomTip: We stayed in the Beach Villa - bit the hotel is designed so we'll that all the rooms are wonderful and all just steps from the pool/beach
text: Luxury escapism among meticulously maintained grounds, a glorious pool, a sweeping beach and smiling staff ready to meet your after need. Food is the highlight here, with Chef Mahinda executing every dish to perfection. There's a serene in-house aryuvedic spa which is the perfect remedy to help you unwind after doing nothing, or surfing et al. On that note, there is a fabulous surf instructor just a couple of food steps from the hotel (along the beach to the right) - it isn't affiliated with the hotel in any way, but it's the perfect opportunity to learn to surf on Wadduwa beach.
title: Luxurious escapism

text: This is a great hotel with the best chefs in Sri Lanka. The food was superb. The staff were so helpful the rooms and public areas lovely however they need more guests. placeInfo: {'id': '1591244', 'name': 'Serene Pavilions', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 422, 'locationString': 'Wadduwa, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.672595, 'longitude': 79.92425, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g499081-d1591244-Reviews-Serene_Pavilions-Wadduwa_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.serenepavilions.com/', 'address': '20 Upali Mawatha, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '20 Upali Mawatha', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Wadduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12560'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 15, 'count2': 14, 'count3': 12, 'count4': 50, 'count5': 331}}
text:
We booked an ocean pavilion at this hotel, which offered some nice amenities including a larger living area, spacious bathroom with a jacuzzi, private pool, and a nice view of the beach. However, the villa itself seemed a bit old and not well-maintained.

Unfortunately, we were unable to use the private pool because it didn't appear clean, despite the hotel staff maintaining it. Similarly, we avoided the hotel's main pool as it also looked less than pristine.

During our stay, we noticed that some staff members seemed to neglect local guests in favor of foreign visitors. Although the villa felt safe and private, the actions of a few staff members made us feel uneasy and dissatisfied during our two-night stay.

Overall, our experience was underwhelming, and considering the various issues we encountered, we did not find the stay worth the cost.
title: Mixed experience: Good facilities, but cleanliness and service need improvement

placeInfo: {'id': '1591244', 'name': 'Serene Pavilions', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 422, 'locationString': 'Wadduwa, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.672595, 'longitude': 79.92425, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g499081-d1591244-Reviews-Serene_Pavilions-Wadduwa_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.serenepavilions.com/', 'address': '20 Upali Mawatha, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '20 Upali Mawatha', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Wadduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12560'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 15, 'count2': 14, 'count3': 12, 'count4': 50, 'count5': 331}}
text:
From the moment you arrive at the hotel you feel that you have arrived to heaven. 
You get a private villa, perfectly equipped, where you can enjoy your vacation, including a private pool and meals in the villa and enjoy the time with the family.
All you hear around is the sound of waves in the sea and the chirping of birds.
From the reception staff, through the private butler (Milan) who is available for you around the clock,  to the house keeping  (Daminda) - everyone makes sure to make your vacation perfect.
We will definitely come back again.
title: Paradise hotel

placeInfo: {'id': '1591244', 'name': 'Serene Pavilions', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 422, 'locationString': 'Wadduwa, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.672595, 'longitude': 79.92425, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g499081-d1591244-Reviews-Serene_Pavilions-Wadduwa_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.serenepavilions.com/', 'address': '20 Upali Mawatha, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '20 Upali Mawatha', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Wadduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12560'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 15, 'count2': 14, 'count3': 12, 'count4': 50, 'count5': 331}}
text: Oh wow - what a wonderful way to finish our Sri Lankan adventure! The hotel room wasn't a room - it was a house! On the ground floor a lovely seating area, dining table and kitchen, with a generous plunge pool just outside. Upstairs a four-poster bed, with a view of the ocean, and the biggest bathroom we have ever seen with jacuzzi bath, his and hers washbasins, huge shower and a dressing room. The rooms look onto a lush garden, with our own private sun loungers, and then the beach and the sea. The beach is west facing and we enjoyed a couple of spectacular sunsets. It really is beautiful, and we didn't want to go anywhere else. There's also a lovely swimming pool with an unusual 'jacuzzi' with bubbling sunbeds. On our final night we were treated to a barbeque on the beach with more fish than we could eat - a fabulous way to end our holiday. Very kind and friendly staff.
title: A very private, luxury boutique hotel on the West Coast of Sri Lanka

placeInfo: {'id': '1591244', 'name': 'Serene Pavilions', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 422, 'locationString': 'Wadduwa, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.672595, 'longitude': 79.92425, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g499081-d1591244-Reviews-Serene_Pavilions-Wadduwa_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.serenepavilions.com/', 'address': '20 Upali Mawatha, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '20 Upali Mawatha', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Wadduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12560'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 15, 'count2': 14, 'count3': 12, 'count4': 50, 'count5': 331}}
text:
Advantages:
1.Good location of the hotel, close to the airport.
2. The beach is good and quite clean with convenient entry.You can swim.
3. Small number of guests.
4.Good equipment of the villas in general. Air conditioning, jacuzzi, etc.
5.Excellent pool in the villa and communal pool with hydromassage.
5. A balanced dinner, not spicy, European.
6. Trained and polite staff.
7.Farewell dinner on the shore.
Disadvantages:
1.Villas and equipment are old. Many things do not work or work poorly. Fans, water pressure, sliding doors open with great effort.
2.The sunbeds on the beach fell into pieces.
3. Monotonous breakfasts. If you live for more than 3 days, it gets a little boring.
4. There is a kitchen corner, but there is no stove, dishes, kitchen utensils, or plates.It's practically useless.
5. The final bill included services and goods that were not actually provided.
title: Sunny and serene

placeInfo: {'id': '1591244', 'name': 'Serene Pavilions', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 422, 'locationString': 'Wadduwa, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.672595, 'longitude': 79.92425, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g499081-d1591244-Reviews-Serene_Pavilions-Wadduwa_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.serenepavilions.com/', 'address': '20 Upali Mawatha, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '20 Upali Mawatha', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Wadduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12560'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 15, 'count2': 14, 'count3': 12, 'count4': 50, 'count5': 331}}
text:
Our honeymoon stay at Serene Pavilions in Wadduwa was an unforgettable experience, with luxurious amenities and impeccable service. Throughout four nights, we were treated to flawless service from the dedicated team, including the butler, cleaning staff, pool attendants, and delicious meals, all under efficient management.

Mr. Malith Pushpakumara, our butler, ensured that our every need was promptly and courteously met, elevating our dining experiences with his meticulous attention to detail. Chef Mr. Shantha's delicious meals added an extra touch of sophistication to each dining experience.

The cleaning staff, led by Mr. Indrakumara, maintained impeccable standards, ensuring our pavilion was spotless and inviting at all times. The pool attendants were attentive, offering refreshments and assistance with lounging arrangements, creating a warm and welcoming atmosphere by the pool Mr.Lakahan.

Throughout our stay, Ms. Wathsala and Mr. Nishantha demonstrated professionalism and responsiveness, promptly addressing any inquiries or requests and ensuring our honeymoon experience was seamless and unforgettable.

Serene Pavilions in Wadduwa provides honeymooners with a romantic and indulgent retreat, characterized by exceptional service from all team members and management, creating cherished memories that will endure a lifetime. Thank you for the wonderful experience. ‚ô•Ô∏è
title: Honeymoon visit

Serene Pavilion Beach Resort is a slice of paradise along the coastline. The resort offers stunning ocean views, luxurious accommodations, and top-notch amenities. From the moment you arrive, you're greeted with friendly staff and a welcoming atmosphere. 

The rooms are spacious and well-appointed, providing a comfortable retreat after a day of sun and sand.

placeInfo: {'id': '1591244', 'name': 'Serene Pavilions', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 422, 'locationString': 'Wadduwa, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.672595, 'longitude': 79.92425, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g499081-d1591244-Reviews-Serene_Pavilions-Wadduwa_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.serenepavilions.com/', 'address': '20 Upali Mawatha, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '20 Upali Mawatha', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Wadduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12560'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 15, 'count2': 14, 'count3': 12, 'count4': 50, 'count5': 331}}
text:
We had the most amazing week at Serene Pavilions, everything was just perfect.  When you first arrive you are instantly welcomed in to the relaxing surrounds of the reception area, which is beautiful.  After a delicious welcome drink you are shown to your own Pavilion, which is immaculate and has everything you could ever need.  These "houses" are very spacious and have lots of little touches and extras you'd expect from a boutique hotel - Serene Pavilions will not disappoint.  We'd also add, the beds and bedding are pure luxury and a good nights sleep is assured.  

You are then introduced to your own butler, who will look after you during your stay; providing you meals and drinks as requested (costs depending on the board you have chosen).
We arrived at night so didn't instantly see the gardens and swimming pool these are beautiful and we enjoyed our time simply wandering around enjoying them and the wildlife they attract.   At the bottom of the grounds is a small fence which leads directly on to the beach.

Finally, what makes Serene Pavilions extra special is the staff, everyone is so friendly and will do anything to make your stay unforgettable.  The team are now more like friends and we can't wait to visit them again and spend more time exploring this wonderful country.
title: An amazing place with special people

placeInfo: {'id': '1591244', 'name': 'Serene Pavilions', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 422, 'locationString': 'Wadduwa, Western Province', 'latitude': 6.672595, 'longitude': 79.92425, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g499081-d1591244-Reviews-Serene_Pavilions-Wadduwa_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.serenepavilions.com/', 'address': '20 Upali Mawatha, Wadduwa 12560 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '20 Upali Mawatha', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Wadduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '12560'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 15, 'count2': 14, 'count3': 12, 'count4': 50, 'count5': 331}}
text: it literally stands to its name. a 50 people capacity in 12 villas with personal pools and an awesome central pool in a tropical garden on a perfect pvt beach. away from the crowd. maybe too peaceful for those who want more cos its an hour from anywhere! the highlight is the chef who should have got a michelin star by now and the staff. everyone ready to do anything to make ur stay super. meals served at ur villa or in the restaurant by the beach. u decide. our attendant Akas Nawodaya never slept i think!!! he was always there ready and happy to serve as was every other staff who despite certain jobs to do were always willing to do whatever was needed. with 3 wheelchair ridden parents, i couldnt have asked for more!!!!!!
title: Amazing Hidden Secret outside Colombo

roomTip: It had a small ground area and I didn't see a good space to walk there. A lengthy pool, If you are looking for some sunshine it's perfect.
text: We got an ocean-view room and it was comfortable, clean, and had a great view. The buffet was average. There was not much ground area and it had a lengthy pool. The sea breeze was really exciting and I love it. Compared to other 4-star hotels, the buffet and ground area are not enough and the room was perfect (It Had a very large bathroom with a bathtub and a large room area with an inside upstairs. Never had such an experience). But for the offer price, it was worth it.
title: Amazing Room Journey

roomTip:
Don‚Äôt rely on the Wifi in room.
Check pool water before you jump in.
Probably need to call reception a few times if you want anything.
text:
Probably will give one star to the gorgeous view and one star to the friendly staff. 

While they are all very friendly, the level of service in cleanliness and responsiveness is absolutely poor. I understand that it was New year period and they were fully booked and probably short of staff. However, we waited about an hour in the lobby for the room to be cleaned and when I reported the TV was not working in the room, we waited more than half an hour and on one came to fix it.
 
Room was not clean either and the water quality in the pool ‚Ä¶. Not recommended for swimming.

Internet speed was sluggishly slow and air conditioning was not working well - imagine after a hot day at the beach and back to a hot room.
title: Poor maintenance and service

text: Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of a tour for a  bit of a rest. We were delighted with the hotel. The staff were so friendly and helpful particularly the restaurant manager and barman. Our room overlooked the pool and beach and the ensuite was enormous with not only a shower but a much welcomed bath.  Yes the pool was missing a few tiles but it was beautifully clean . The beach and sea left us speechless. The waves were fabulous and the sea was so warm. Definitely  recommend this place.
title: Fantastic stay
